review: The last two times I've been to CPK have been very pleasant. Both occasions our server was Daisy and she was very nice, helpful and would check on us occasionally. While waiting for our order, they give us complimentary bread with a side of virgin olive oil.  Unfortunately I don't like pizza, so I come here for the pasta. I get their Garlic Cream Fettuccine, which consists of garlic parmesan cream sauce with fresh Italian parsley. I also add chicken which is an additional $3, but I don't mind, because they serve a big portion. The prices for their meals are a fair amount, just like any other restaurant.    Overall my experiences at CPK were excellent and would definitely come back if I'm ever craving their pasta.

Always liked food at CPK. But I noticed how they reduced the portion size Of their food.   Service 2/5 Food 4/5 Portion 1/5 We used to go there a couple of times a month, the whole family. We won't be stopping there again.

Well, I took my wife and son for dinner tonight, 8/6/2017, around 6pm.  I don't even know where to get started.  First of all the table they sat my wife my son and I was dirty, even the floor had all kinds of food on it. I asked them to put us on a different table.  Then we waited for a while before we saw our waitress, the place didn't seem that busy, but she seemed very ocupied and in a hurry.  She took our order which it took a while for our food to arrive.  She brought bread with olive oil,  but my son wanted butter which are had to wait a while to see her and order the butter. Which arrive arrive the same time as my son's pizza. My salad was okay, my wife found an ant on her pasta plate which she reply "I don't know how to react to that" Very poor customer service to say the least! . When we got the check my wife notice that our macaroni and cheese appetizer had never arrived,  which she said "don't worry I will take it off the bill as if she was doing us a huge favor. We has visited this place couple times before,  and food was decent with average customer service.  But this time, everything went wrong, my wife and I tried our son's pizza and it was like a piece of cardboard,  no taste no flavor.  It will be a very, very long time if and consider going back, and/or referring anyone to try this place.

I normally LOVE cpk!!! But I went last Saturday ordered some apps and the bbq chicken pizza. Our egg rolls had hair in them and the pizza was undercooked. I don't know, mistakes happen .... I alerted our server who took away the food, she acted kind of insulted. I felt awkward bringing it up but I'm sorry I'm a germaphobe and I'm not trying to eat a pizza that the crust isn't cooked all the way through. The manager came to the table trying to be chummy with a lame excuse. He said the hair had to have been from a brush because they brush them with butter. Really? There was no butter flavor nothing ...... um. I'm not buying it. The icing on the cake was when he told me to look over at the guy at the bar who was bald and say he's the cook it couldn't be a hair..... I'm sorry but that's the bartender. I'm not a fool. I left and will never go back.

This was the first time I have ever been to CPK. I actually have never heard of this place before, but we were given a gift card for Christmas. The staff was very friendly & we were seated pretty quickly. It seemed like it was starting to get a little busy after we arrived, so we were understanding with our server not getting to us quickly to check our drinks for refills. Her friendly & helpful attitude more than made up for it, & kept the evening pleasant. We got the spinach artichoke dip for an appetizer, along with the free bread to start with. Followed by a hand tossed margherita pizza, and hand tossed carne asada pizza, to share as a family, and a kids Hawaiian pizza & fruit for my son. Everything was so delicious and filling. Well I can only take my husband & daughter's word on the carne asada pizza since I'm allergic to onions & cilantro tastes weird to me, but they say it was delicious. We had a great experience & will definitely be back some time in the future. I wish I could remember our server's name (but I suck with names). She was so friendly & just great.

I've always loved California Pizza Kitchen, but back when I used to eat chicken I would get the barbecue chicken pizza which was so good! They have so many different options for vegans and vegetarians on the menu so I can still enjoy this restaurant! There were some buffalo cauliflower appetizers that we got and they were so delicious! I probably could have eaten five of the appetizers by myself! If you're at California Pizza Kitchen and you're curious what they taste like, order them you will not be disappointed! It's like a healthy chicken wing. Hahaha! The service here is always great, the drinks are good and always refilled in time, and the staff is very friendly and attentive. The restaurant is always very clean also!

Came in for lunch with my girls got seated right away server was prompt and courteous. Had the pizza and salad lunch special for 12 bucks. The pizza was good the salad was also good however could have used more dressing. Felt the price was a little high for what we got but other than that good service and good food not great but good.

ABSOLUTELY LOOOVE THIS PLACE!! I have only had it twice but the first time my husband and I sat down. The seating was fast and the staff was friendly and the for the wait time it was accurate giving the fact the restaurant was packed!. That is always a good sign of great service and fantastic food options  my FAVE THE CARNE ASADA PIZZA!!!!!!, cauliflower buffalo its literally taste like a buffalo wing with crumble of blue cheese n celery it's delicious as it melts away when u eat it . I RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT TO ANYONE WANTING TO HAVE A GREAT DINNER WORTH EVERY PENNY, in my opinion.

Sometimes I forget that this "mall" has a CPK, but from time-to-time, I dine here for a specific craving: pasta. It has never occurred to me (until today) how lackluster their customer service is, which is surprising to say the least because they are not at all busy, ever. Even the host took me and boyfriend to our table in a blasé, zombie-like fashion. Despite the fact that their service has lowered over the past couple of years, their food satiates my carb desire. I think my favorite pasta is the garlic fettuccine alfredo with chicken, but I enjoy their tequila chicken fettuccine, as well as their pesto chicken penne. I do think they need to lessen on the oils, because it tends to get a little too greasy. Also, I can't forget their caesar salad, which is probably one of my favorite caesar's.  It amazes me how above average their prices are for such an average restaurant. Their price range for certain items goes hand-in-hand with The Cheesecake Factory, but these two restaurants are definitely not on par with one another.

I cannot get over how bad CPK  has become.  In the last two months we have three bad experiences.  Called for take out for our daughters.  They leave to go pick it up.  Cpk calls me and says they can't cook anything.  Kitchen issue.  Why did they take the order?  Second incident a week later.  Our favorite menu items are gone.  I'll give them a pass as that's corporate.  We go back today.  We waited so long for our food to be served.  When it arrived my Blt pizza was inedible.  Burnt and the crust was like a cracker.  I realize they serve a cracker crust but not for this pizza. My daughter's cheese pizza was the same.  My other daughters"s  pizza had chicken on it Which was like rubber.  We won't be going back until they fix this.

We called ahead asking for the expected wait for four people the hostess said 20 mins. We arrived three mins later prepared to wait. The place was empty we scratched our heads to why she said 20 mins but moved on. We then order the garlic chicken pizza was not that good. We then waited 10 mins for a box and then 10 mins for the check and it was dead agsin a head scratcher. The waitress was nice but service was satisfactory at best.

Surprisingly they were not crowded for the Veteran's Day free lunch. Will probably go back next year since it's close to me and we thoroughly enjoyed the  pizza. Hadn't been to a CPK in quite some time. We tried the Italian chopped which was definitely lacking something....we decided it needed pepperoncini. Priced at over $15 but free for Veteran's day we thought it was a little too spendy. The pizza on the other hand is priced at around $15  but really tasty. We got the sausage pepperoni and mushroom which had a good amount of cheese and toppings and the crust is not oily at all. While wine seemed a bit pricey at over $10 for a 9oz pour, our server was great. Besides getting our entrees comped for veteran's day, we thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary hot bread that was served with an herb EVOO...yummm.

I'm only rating the gluten free pizza we bought here. I wasn't happy with the price when compared with the gf pizza at Project Pie and disliked what I saw here at double.  The taste is far better and doesn't seem like I'll have the same methane output. Project Pie gave me lots of gas.
Food was good! Service was excellent! Sam was our server and she was on top of it!! Butter cake was amazing!! They offer discount for military.
I've been coming here forever,  my girls grew up eating the Sicilian Pizza they absolutely love it. This place is great.

Just wanted to say thanks for the Hat-Tip treatment. I slunk in at more normal odd hour, wanted to go to this location for some time. This area of the city has a Temecula vibe.  I was greeted and sat at this time of day it's just who ever feels like taking the table so the stations haven't been assigned yet. The person I got was great they have no idea it will be the best tip of the day regardless of what I order.  I know what it's like to need people and no one is walking in the door. So I give more even short my order if I need. CPK really hires the cream of the USA Crop.  I ordered my regular double-fisted ice teas, with red velvet cake no ice cream. Then when it's time A barbecue chicken pizza on honey wheat dough add avocado and bacon with a side of garlic chili sauce make that two.  It's was great.  Only down side was the tables are way way to sticky.  I will be back queens of pizza.

I have been to this CPK several times and this visit was mediocre.  I had fish tacos which consisted 3 tacos filled mostly with cabbage and avocado and the smallest amount of fish you have every seen.  The service was subpar; had to wait for water refills and the check took forever to get.  My wife and son left while I waited for the check.  Not good, would not recommend this CPK.

Took the family to lunch on a Saturday afternoon, not busy at all. We were seated immediately. I ordered the chicken tequila pasta, it was mediocre. The chicken was a bit over cooked, and the pasta was dry. I have ordered this dish on several occasions in fashion valley mall and has never been this dry.  The pepperoni pizza was excellent. The dough was very soft, crispy and brown. A little more cheese could have been added but overall the herbs and pepperoni were a perfect addition to the excellent pizza dough. My son loved his kids cheese pizza. It was the perfect portion size for him and he even took 3 slices home.  My biggest complaint was my waitress went MIA. On 3 different occasions, we had to ask 2 servers walking by to refill our drinks, give me my check and for more napkins. She was not very attentive nor friendly at all. Not the best service. I'll be returning back to Fashion Valley.

3 stars on a Friday night because they can't keep up with the demand! walked in at 745ish and ordered beer and got it in 20 mins then ordered food got that 25 mins later and I asked for silverware and I watched my server take another order before grabbing my fork!!! Why would she bring me my salad and nothing to eat it with. we never saw her again until we asked for our bill. true the food was good as it always is, but that's no excuse to lack on customer service! I'd be lying if I said I wasn't coming back, so I will be back but not on a busy Friday night!! the veggie grilled salad is delicious FYI!

Food was good, but my server Javier made sure my experience wasn't the best. First he came to our table very late (it wasn't busy). He took our drink order, and we had to wait another 15 minutes for him to take our food order. He was never around or came back to check up on us. Every time we needed something he never acknowledged our table, when he finally brought us refills he basically just dropped it on the table. Overall cpk is good but Javier could've at-least tried.

Always a very good meal. Nice mix on the menu choices. Service was great...friendly, attentive, professional. Thank you Samantha for making this another enjoyable dinner...glad we had your table again. Cheers!
Pizza was cold, orders the 5 cheese and tomatoes, and California club. Gave me a wrong pizza. They offer a gift card but will never again buy anything from CPK.

I have mixed emotions about this place and I have to be careful of what I post to review. Bottom line, I wish that the servers knew how to better take care of larger tables and groups. I wish that the food was better than it currently is.

Finally came here last night after I've been DYING to go, since I'm like obsessed w/ pasta. First off, their spinach & artichoke dip is AMAZING (perfect texture, perfect balance of ingredients) & the tortilla chips are fresh & crispy. I ordered the jambalaya pasta & it was sooo good. Love the generous amount of crawfish, shrimp, sausage & ham. I was also super amazed at how quickly our food was brought out. Everything came out perfectly cooked & we literally had all the food we ordered on our table in under 5-10 mins. Although our waitress seemed kinda rushed, I didn't mind since we were literally able to sit down, order drinks, order food, have the leftovers boxed & be out the door. I appreciate that kind of service.

First of all...very slow and bad service.  Food was overall good, but server was not attentive at all. We had to ask him 3 times and more to refill our drinks and never around when we need him. I can't believe how this restaurant trains their employees.  And finally I asked server to input my reward card number and I was told that he will, but never happened.  So I made sure that he would input after we got our bill, but he didn't. This might sound like nothing,  but I think that even small things that server was asked to do is also very important.. it is customer satisfaction.  The conclusion is that I was very unsatisfied,  and not sure if I should go back to a restaurant that ignores customers attention.

Pizza is one of my favorite foods in the world. But when it comes to CPK (California Pizza Kitchen), I say only this: their pizza (and pasta) is amazing! My favorite is the Sicilian thin crust pizza plus the four cheese ravioli. They also have a place to sit outside plus it's kid friendly. I remember going to CPK when I was a little kid and loved it there. As of today, I still am amazed by the selections that they have. If anyone wants to go to a pizza joint where they can spend time with family or friends or whoever, this is the place to be. I almost forgot to mention that they also have a ton of locations all over California. The one that I went to was in Chula Vista. Keep it up CPK! :-)

Have been here for both lunch and dinner.  We usually order up a pizza, pasta, and share a salad.     Really have enjoyed there Barebecue chicken pizza and there thai salad. From my experience there staff is pretty friendly, and quick.

My family and I have been visiting the Otay Ranch Town Center CPK for many years now.  The general manager, Jesse, and assistant manager, Russell have always made it a point to great all their customers.  I see them making time for every customer, not just us.  The wait staff, especially Mark, has been awesome!  Mark has a wonderful sense of humor.  He never fails to make us laugh. The food is absolutely delicious!  We love everything they cook up at this CPK.  We love the appetizers, main dishes and dessert.

Busiest days are usually Fri-Sun right? Came in about an hour ago and there was only a few others in here. Well that didn't help the server at all.  Took drink orders, then kept an impatient attitude when I said my party needed a little bit of time to decide what we wanted. Came back with the drinks. Fast forward to waiting on refills- brought it out only when we were done and not to mention never came by to see how the food was, etc. Go down the street to Tavern and Bowl and get better service, or just look around when you're in CPK and see that the lack of customers just might be a hint.
Close to movie theaters.  Gift you get the Jamaican Jerk pizza make sure you get the regular crust and not thin crust.

Had dinner here last night 4/29. Kids love coming here so we come at least 2 times a month and service is hit and miss. But, that all changed last night when we had Brian as our server. Excellent service all around he was friendly, attentive just had an overall wonderful experience.  Thanks Brian!!!

Business lunch was perfect.  Seated promptly, booth available and service friendly and prompt.  Food is consistently amazing.  Ordered my second favorite, chicken Thai crunch full order.  Could only finish half but I planned to have it as dinner later tonight.  Music was a little loud for a business lunch but not anything unbearable.  Definitely recommend for casual lunch or business meeting.

I stopped in for din and saw on the table an add for their small plates ( ). The items looked good, so I decided to order a few items from it. I ordered the petite wedge at $4.65, a spinach and mushroom flat bread pizza and a fennel sausage, and poblano flat bread pizza both at $5.95. The petite wedge was larger than I expected and came with a modest amount of savory bacon, a good creamy blue cheese dressing, and some chopped eggs and tomatoes ( ). The bacon was good, chewy, and slightly smokey. ( ) It was my favorite part of the salad, second was the creamy blue cheese. The salad came with some sliced sourdough baguette which was quite good and chewy. ( ) The bread was excellent with the herb filled oil oil served on the side. ( ) Both flat breads were enjoyable to eat. They use the same dough they use for their well known pizzas. The crust on both was light, thin with a slight elasticity. The mushroom and spinach was my favorite. (  The mushrooms had a pleasant earthy overtone and were lightly cooked. Everything just gelled well together specifically the well cooked and seasoned spinach. ( ) I thought the fennel sausage flat bread was good, but not as balances as the mushroom one. Don't get me wrong, it looked great (See), and it tasted good, but the sausage was a little weak in flavor ans lacked that aggressive fennel flavor. ( ) It was a little spicy, as advertised, and the poblanos tasted mixed with the melted cheese. ( ) I enjoyed a warm tea with my meal, and the service provided by my server Brian was spot on. He was well mannered and had a good sense of humor. I am definitely a fan of their well priced small plates...

what the heck happened?  use to be a decent place to eat.  good thing i didnt want a draft either, their beer taps werent working.  really?  how is that acceptable?  spinach fettucini with extra $4.50 DRY chicken.  makes you wonder when it was originally cooked, especially given the server came back and said it would take 8minutes to cook another piece.  did i mention the place was only 20% full?  the portions appear to be dwindling too.  first time ive ever finished the tequila chicken pasta.  and the server?  why do i have to ask for everything?  balsamic for the bread, parmesan and pepper for the pasta, napkins.  i dont think it is her fault however.  i was observing the manager, seems to me its his fault.  ive seen "managers" run a place into the ground before.  why, early on a thursday evening, is this place empty for dinner??  and wtf cant i get a stout???  oh yeah mr manager, your taps are down.  #getaCLUEdude

Dine in food and service are great, take out not so much.  My husband and I dine here regularly and enjoy the food and service, but my take out experiences are 0-3.  The first time, they had no record of me phoning in the order.  The second time I asked that there be no eggs in my salad, but when I got home, they were everywhere.  To their credit, they gave me a full refund.  Today, I ordered the Moroccan Chicken salad, no eggs.  I checked the salad before I left the restaurant to make sure there were no eggs and there weren't.  When I got home, I discovered there was no chicken either! Unbelievable!

I tried the spinach and artichoke dip, the pesto penne, BBQ chicken pizza and Thai pizza. They all taste standard to me, nothing great but nothing bad. The best out of what I've tried was probably the pesto penne. I would probably get it again if and only if I choose to come back. Place was very clean, big, and organized. But to be honest I don't think it's ever packed at this location.  All the waiters and hostesses seemed to not like their job and was really whatever about everything. Made me a little annoyed. Everything about CPK is a bit overpriced, but, it's a CPK, what do you expect. Maybe I'll come back for the pasta, and a drink? Maybe?

I always liked CPK's pizza's.  They also have some pretty tasty pastas here to consume.  This restaurant is in a prime spot next to the AMC theater and the Barnes and Noble.  Very clean restaurant, nice set up, it would be a good date spot to be honest.  Service has always been good for me.  Full bar too boot.

Two words. Hot mess. Worst service ever. I feel bad writing negative Yelp reviews, but there is no excuse for waiting over an hour for food. Especially when your server never checks on you or even apologizes for the wait. No refills and cold soup at this CPK location (Otay ranch). And servers that don't give a hoot about their customers. Management should pay closer attention when their employees are struggling and neglecting their tables.

A very good national chain american restaurant. Pizzas and salads are good. Ample kids menu. Kid friendly. Menu is more than pizza and chicken. Chicken chimichurri, fish tacos and chile relleno are a must. Clean, modern and great service. In my experience the majority of the servers at this location are bilingual.
Had a great lunch yesterday at this place.  Nice coconut speciality drink with a flatbread.

Went to otay ranch mall to buy some shoes for my daughter. We were both hungry and decided to eat at CPK. I was greeted by a beautiful young hostess(sorry I didn't caught her name). I told her a sit for two please and  she smiled and told me to have a sit. Just wait a few minutes and I'll seat you. I said okay thank you. Few minutes later we were seated in a booth. Then got our drinks ordered. Shortly after our waiter brought my daughter and I freshly baked bread and dipping oil to the table. I place my order for a sausage, mushroom and pepperoni pizza. Oh man that hit the spot it was very good. Over all the service, food and cleanliness of the restaurant was excellent. Definitely coming back for some more pizza that for sure. That's all I got thank you and happy yelping :-)

There is a reason I gave them 3 stars and not 4 however, they do have good food for the most part. I ordered a pizza and it was good when I had some hot there. however, I had left  over and tell you what there pizza is not very good the next day. That was the gluten free.

Just ate at the Otay ranch location I was very satisfied with my server Daisy:) she has the best customer service skills and is extremely friendly. I will definitely be back just to see her. After a shitty day she really made us smile thank you Daisy

My dad's a veteran who served 27 years in the Navy and out of all the deals going on on Veteran's Day we decided to go to CPK. Such amazing service from our waiter Kyle Blaine!! Honestly the best server! He was very welcoming, attentive, and was constantly checking up on us. My dad enjoyed lunch even more. So thank you CPK!

Nothing wrong with a Stella with pizza n soup!! Hehe.  There is no one in here at 3 ish. So we got in on the lunch special till 4! Wanted some lunch b4 we went into the movie. Waitress was nice n friendly too. I had the shaved mushroom, olive oil and parm pizza with pea soup. Wow I love their pizza crust so lite n crunchy. Soup was fantastic too. I will have to remember to put barley in my pea soup next time. Tasty!  So now small popcorn next door haha. Bf had the picture, pep, sausage with Met salad! Another fab meal at California Pizza kitchen.

The first time we visited CPK was when they first opened and we were so disappointed in the service we didn't return until last week. We decided to give them a chance and we were glad we did. The service was outstanding which is hard to find in most establishments. The food and drinks were very good. We sat at the bar and shared a pizza and a salad.  We were so impressed with our server, Sam that we mentioned to the manager what a great employee she was. The manager was grateful for the feedback and went out of his way to make our dining experience special.

It's ok. Went in for lunch and there was no line. The host seemed really confused and wasn't sure where to seat us (there were plenty of tables open and it did not appear that they were in the middle of a lunch rush).  Tortilla soup had a lumpy broth and oil tracing the rims.  I asked to sub the lunch pizza for a margherita pizza. Not possible I guess.

Gone here a few times over the years, and things have remained consistent.  Our latest dinner here was on a weekday, around 6:30, not busy at all and we were seated right away. Lots of tables, they can accommodate larger groups. Clean. Nice location, in front of AMC by otay ranch mall. Our service was good. We were checked on periodically. Drinks, ordering, and receiving our food was all within a good timeframe. We were given warm bread with infused olive oil while waiting.  The food...  Tortilla soup- tasted kinda more like a bean soup, a thick consistency, but with a little hint of Spanish flavor.. It was just all right... Mushroom pizza- yummy.. If you like mushrooms on your pizza, you will like this dish. The flavor is so rich. Yum! Crust was chewy and toasty, I believe their pizzas are wood fired...  Kids pizza/Alfredo- what my kids got. They're both generous portions and the pizza was basically a smaller version of their regular pizzas (prepared the same way)...  My fave think on their menu is the THAI CRUNCH salad. Edamame, chicken, crispy thin white noodles, shredded cabbage, green onions, peanuts, etc, with a sweet peanut/sesame flavor.. We always get the full (large) serving... 3 of us shared 2 large orders, we like it that much... I've tried it with and without avocado, both ways are tasty.  Not usually our first pick for going out... But it's a place we go from time to time when craving their Thai crunch salad!

I called to make a Take-Out order and when I got there I called again just to let them know I was already outside. A guy answered and told me it would be right now. 40 minutes pass and I call again and no one answered. 15 minutes pass and I call again and still no answer so I decide togo inside and get it myself. My food was just sitting there, my pasta was all dry from just sitting there. The cashier (very lovely girl) was kind enough to take the pasta back to the kitchen so they could add more sauce and she said no one had told her I called to say I was already outside, so I don't blame her at all.  On a side note, when you call to place an order they always ask if you would like some bread. Every single time I ask for bread I don't get it, and when I don't ask for bread I do get bread. Write it down it's not that hard. Other than that, I got the original bbq chicken salad and the chicken tequila fettuccini. Both were very good! (like always)

One of our favorite spots to go with the family. The kids order there boring mac and cheese and order tons of the free bread with olive oil. The wife and I always seem to order the same things. We both share a Kung Pao Spaghetti with shrimp and a Waldorf Salad with chicken. Today we added sangria tasters which both added color to the table and taste! The place hardly gets too crowded and the food comes out in a timely manner. The service is always good to us especially since we always refill drinks and bread.  Ive had most of the flatbreads and they are also good. The hummus is always a good appetizer.  The take out service is also something we use. The food is easy to order online and they package everything perfectly. *Hint: you can ask for a bunch of free bread!

Stopped in today around 6pm, I ordered two pizzas to go. It took a long time to get anyone's attention to help me, and the girl that did had a bad attitude and was in a hurry and unkind. I had a hard time readying the menu since I forgot my reading glasses. After she helped me I asked for napkins which she very rudely handed me. Unfortunately did not get her name. She was a young pretty Hispanic girl.  It's too bad she gave such poor customer service. I will not be coming back here.

I've always been a fan of the food at CPK.  My go-to dish at this location is their Cedar Plank Salmon.  My daughter usually gets one of their pastas and she loves it. The food is really consistent and compared to the rest of the restaurants at this mall, the wait for a table is not too bad.  My only gripe is the service.  Waiters and waitresses have always been nice, but it seems to take forever for your orders to be taken and even longer for your food to arrive.   2016 Yelp Review #8
Very standard food, even with an updated menu.  Service this time was good, considering the driving rain and the holiday crowds.  Of all places to eat in this location, CPK is the best of most.

Ordered my usual Chicken Tequila Fettuccine and it was disastrous. The sauce was soupy almost like a broth on the bottom rather than a creamy fettuccine sauce. Fettuccine was undercooked. Pizza was mediocre. All bad. I love CPK but this particular location needs to get it together.  I just found out that on top of all this they OVERCHARGED MY CARD! My boyfriend and I split the bill of $50 I got charged the full $50 AND $25 extra and my boyfriend got charged $25. This place is ridiculous. If I could rate it zero I would!!!

Have been eating here for years and last 3 times that I have ordered some sort of salad, I end up returning it and then they make it right..  Why cant you make it right the 1st time.   This is the last time I eat here.  Major fail cpk.

My boyfriend and I tried tried the California Pizza Kitchen for the first time today. We were in the Otay Ranch Shopping Center running some errands and doing some shopping when we decided on pizza for lunch. After entering we were greeted right away and taken to out booth. I will say that the booth wasn't as clean, but we didn't mind. Our server was Shar and she was super sweet and awesome!! Since this was our first time she made some great suggestions with appetizers and desserts. She suggested the Avacado Club Rolls and we were so glad she suggested those to us because they were our favorite out of everything we had during our visit!! She was always very attentive and had had a great attitude (wonderful customer service!!). We also ordered the BBQ chicken pizza and it wasn't bad. It was served on a thin crust pizza with light BBQ and the chicken was scattered all around. We also ordered the chocolate cake like dessert with ice cream on top (athlsolso athlsolso suggestion from Shar) and we devoured that within minutes! Overall a good experience and worth coming in again. We hope to get Shar next time too!!!

Our first time dining at this establishment.  We ordered the pepperoni pizza, the chicken BBQ pizza, the Cobb salad and the mushroom pasta with shrimp plate. The size of the pizzas were kind of on the small side for the price we pay. The pizzas were good.  I would like to see the pizza's just a little bigger.  The chicken BBQ pizza was a tad bit on skimpy side with the toppings.  The Cobb salad was great in portion and toppings.  Great Cobb salad and the mushroom pasta dish with shrimp my Wife ordered  was real delicious.  Our server was great. My wife had a flight of wine and a  flight of the sangrias.  She enjoyed both of her flights. I enjoyed 2 different beers on draft. I would return to try out more dishes and pizza from the menu.
Not good place to go, servers are slow and it takes a long time to get and make your order. Foods are not that good too.

For a Chula Vista non-mom & pop corporate restaurant, it's a good place to go to. Convenient, accessible, close to the theaters, would make a great alternative to long waits at Cheesecake Factory or Buffalo Wild Wings (in fact, their food is much better than Buffalo Wild Wings), and a very good wine list compared to other restaurants in the Otay Ranch Town Center. We love their shaved mushroom & spinach flatbread, quinoa + arugula salad, and their chicken piccata entree. CPK's chicken piccata is the one dish I compare all other chicken piccata's to! It's very good (especially when paired with a good Chardonnay wine). Their house sourdough bread served with olive oil is also delicious. Remind your server to bring some bread over if it's not automatically offered. Our service was very good the night we had dinner. They offer a 9 oz wine serving which is a little more than 2 glasses for like $3 more (a pretty good deal)...

Love it here! The service is for the most part fast it's never too packed & the girls here are very friendly from the front door girls to the waitresses & until you leave they are always nice.  The food is always good. And you get FREE little breads with Olive Oil & it taste great! And I always get there tortilla soup, tho this is a pizza place I have to admit they have one of the best tortilla soups I've ever tasted! There Cesar salad is very good but I would ask for extra dressing tho because it can be a bit dry sometimes.  My fav pasta here is the Pesto Pasta, it's  made with the perfect amount of Pesto sauce & always well made & delicious. Now for the main reason I come here, the Chicken Thai Pizza! If my wife knew how to make this I would never argue with her & kiss her dirty feet (she likes to be barefooted in the house)  & massage her everyday & dance for her in my boxers!  Love it, comes with the bean sprouts & peanut sauce & veggies & the perfect amount of Chicken. All there pizza come perfectly cooked in thin crust & are good but this one is my favorite & the main reason why I come back. There outside patio is real nice & there bar is as well, there beer & wine selection here is pretty good. You can bring you're kids as well, there kids menu is reasonable. The prices are decent. It's a great place to come for lunch or for dinner after going to the movies next door & when you come order the Chicken Thai Pizza you won't regret it! And enjoy the FREE bread with Olive Oil of course.

What a wonderful restaurant and business!  We held a fundraiser night there and they were responsive from day one answering my questions promptly.  The evening of the event, the servers were attentive. I was worried that some people would forget their flyer and my server said he had extras in his apron in case this happened. As I visited with many families, my server asked me if I wanted him to bring my food to another table. Such great server.  THEN, the evening THAT VERY SAME DAY, I got an email telling me how the fundraiser had done and thanking me. What!!!!  Finally, I got a call just a few days later letting me know that the check for our percentage had arrived and was ready for pick up.  When I went in to pick up the check, I was complementing the manager and he told me the General Manager just happened to be there and introduced me.  I got to tell him how much we had enjoyed our time there. From beginning to end, our CPK experience was a delightful surprise. I can't wait to go back!  Thank you CPK.

Food was exceptional.  But service was terrible. When it comes to going in for happy hour no specials. When it comes to  ordering drinks from the bar they need serious improvements on thier time of service.   Food very tasty. But pricy. Expecially for the amounts of other eateries in this area,  that hold a competitive happy hour menu.

Two stars is probably generous considering our experience at CPK tonight. I feel a bit silly now looking back on it...all the signs that a terrible experience was about to ensue were present, I just chose to ignore them. My first tip should have been the lack of customers in the restaurant. Sure it was a Wednesday night, but it was 6:30 and the shopping center was busy. I thought maybe we lucked out and were just ahead of the evening rush. Not so much. When we walked in we were seated promptly in a booth by the bar. There were only a handful of other customers scattered throughout the restaurant.  Our server came out quickly and took our drink order. One goose martini, one Stone IPA (in a bottle with a glass, since we were informed they did not have Stone on draft), and one lemonade. After a few minutes we look over and see our server preparing the martini behind the bar. This would not be a concern if she looked as though she knew what she was doing or it was the best drink we ever had. Unfortunately, the martini came out half empty and the beer was a bottle of Stella Artois. Thankfully I caught this before the server opened it; however, upon her realizing her mistake she also realized the don't carry Stone IPA...at all. My husband settled for a Rogue and we proceeded to order.  My mother and I decided to partake in the dinner for two special, which our server was not very familiar with to say the least...even though we all had it in our menu and it was discussed with us by the hostess. The special came with an appetizer, two entrees, and dessert. We ordered spinach and artichoke dip, a BBQ chicken salad (hold the tortilla strips), a pepperoni/mushroom/sausage pizza, thin crust (hold the oregano), and hubby ordered a garlic chicken pizza separately. We would order desert after the meal.  The spinach dip came out in record time...and that was the only part of the meal this restaurant seemed to consider time sensitive. The meal itself took about a half hour (let me take this moment to remind you again how the restaurant was not busy). When our meal finally did arrive, we were short the pepperoni pizza. The kitchen staff accidentally put oregano on it and was going to remake it. The process of remaking a pizza must be cumbersome and convoluted because my husband and I were well finished with our meals before it came out. This is also after asking the server where it was a couple times, and a visit from the manager.  After awhile we asked they just box it up since everyone was finished with their food and understandably irritated by this time. The manger brought out the box, apologized again and walked away. Our server took another ten minutes to find her way back to us to see if we needed anything further. Umm yes, the dessert we are paying for. Red velvet please. After another 15 minutes the cake came out (they must have been baking it from scratch) and we paid our bill and left.  We had $7 taken off our bill. That is what CPK felt we deserved after having the worst dinner and service we have had in at least 4 years. We will not be back.  The food was good, which landed the two stars; however, the pizza they redid still had oregano on it. We didn't feel it was worth the hassle of mentioning it, nor did we feel like they would care.  Get your act together CPK. No wonder there was no wait for dinner.
Came here for the first time, really good service, and food was given to us within a fair time. The food was delicious! I would love to come here again.

Had such horrible experience last night 7/5/15 8pm at California Pizza Kitchen @  Otay Ranch, the server Mike H. And who was supose to be the manager in shift Brian were extremely rude and unethical not only did they got our oder wrong and glasses were dirty and employees were fooling around like if they were at a elementary play ground . Extremely disappointed i can see this branch closing soon due to thier poor customer service after my experience and reading so many bad reviews they i have no dought in telling anyone to think about it twice before going to the Otay Ranch location very poor service.

This CPK is nice and has a lot of space. However, that's the only good thing about the place. To start with the food was horrible and probably the worst I've ever eaten. It was so bad that CPK should be on kitchen nightmares. I mean everything was cold and it was so bad I'd rather eat out of the McDonald's dining room floor.  Second, the service was also horrible. All of the servers should just stick to fast food restaurants. Finally, I think that ever since they switched from Pepsi they've gone to the shit. Don't expect me back.

Having a kid with celiacs disease is hard. We can't go to most places because asking for gluten free is like saying a string of curse words. They looked shocked and amazed you would ask for that . California pizza kitchen is the exception to that rule. They offer gluten free pizza at a good cost and my  9yo child loves pizza so celiacs friendly CPK is the only place we can get him take out. Not only was it gluten free it was as he told me really good. My son asked me to write this review because this is the first time he was able to order take out since his diagnosis.

Four stars, I am very frugal with the stars and I didnt think CPK was going to get this from me at first.  The service: Excellent, their over priced food was also delicious.  You cant go wrong with the original bbq chicken pizza (large enough for two to share). Nice cocktail selection as well and located in a nice outdoor mall.

We eat here often, and the food has been consistently good. I get the Chicken Picatta with the pasta or the Sicilian Pizza. They are both so good that my mouth is watering as I write. The only reason I gave four stars is because my chicken was undercooked one time.

I decided to have lunch today at CPK and I ordered the lettuce wraps which are great when you're trying to eat healthy. They were amazing in there definitely big enough to share for two people. Mark our server was awesome food was great the great customer service I will definitely be back.

Absolutely horrible and has gone down hill. They use frozen chicken for all there products except the salads and pasta. Went there tonight and had globs of mayo in my club pizza. Husband ordered his use to be favorite waldorf salad and the salad tasted like it was bad. When we spoke with the manager he was actually rude! It was just an absolute horrible experience the food has just gone down hill!!!

The service here was great and food was good. Their selection of pizzas has changed quite a bit over the years and a lot of my faves has disappeared. It does come down to personal preference but the pizzas here are hit or miss.  The original bbq chicken pizza was delish! But the california club was highly disappointing. I don't think that should even be called a pizza since it was basically pizza dough with a salad on top of it. As in nothing was baked into the crust except the few pieces of bacon. This is a nice place to hang out and split a few pizzas with friends or family. It is located in the Otay mall so it's in a great location for you to grab some food and do some shopping. I would eat here if I happen to be in the area but I don't think it's something I would go out of my way for.
It's CPK what do you expect.  The service was good, the food is good, and I'd definitely take my family again.  They don't offer military discount here.

Located in a nice, outdoor suburban mall, across the street from the AMC 12 theater, I figured the food would be decent, somewhere in between Pizza Hut and Pizza Nova. ( ) The food was decent but not the best it could have been.  The soup was barely warm and the pizza was fresh cooked but not "fresh out of the oven" hot.  I think they must have put it aside until the other dishes were ready.  The dumplings that were an appetizer (small bites?) were bland.  It was an hour before closing and I could already hear the cooks and other kitchen staff beating and banging the pots as they were cleaning up.   Another effect of getting here near closing time - the servers were getting the "almost time to go home" syndrome and were not being as attentive as expected.  Or, as some other Yelpers have noticed, the service might just suck all the time.

Great service, especially for a Saturday. Not too crowded with great atmosphere. What really made the whole experience with the service of kathia behind the bar. She was handling everyone at the bar with efficiency and kindness. Super impressed, I will definitely come here again.

I started meeting here with friends for lunch. Since there is a big group I was worried about the food being served on time and them being able to handle a crowd. They have a great patio that we overtake. The management here is wonderful. Willing to work out a system so everyone can have a good time but get out in a timely manner. Bonus: The food is fantastic!! While I am eating my food, which is delicious, I am eyeing what others got and can't wait to try that next time. Usually I am a girl who sticks with the same thing every time, not here.

They have a brand new Miso Shrimp Salad on the menu - excellent! As always, great food, great service, great location, ample parking, separate take-out entrance for fast service.  Immediately across from the AMC Otay Ranch Town Center theatres.  Yum!

Came in for lunch with my girlfriends that I haven't seen in a while. We decided to sit on the patio... Big mistake ! I felt like we were neglected the whole time. Service was extremely slow, which I am not sure why because there was literally 7 other tables sat. Drinks took forever to come, they were only waters. A different server brought the food out and we didn't see our server until the end of the meal when we were ready for our check. We wanted to order actual drinks but was over it. Why wouldn't she come and see how the food came out ? Food was good but the pasta needed more sauce. We were just ready to get out. Then we waited 10 minutes before we went to the front to pay. If we asked for the bill I would think she knew we'd be ready to pay. Guess not. I'm disappointed because I usually like this place, but I just won't do this location.

CPK what can I say, you make some neat pizzas everyday. But for the price I pay is not the way for a constantly broke person today.  But damn the salads are pretty big and tasty if your a herbivore than a carney. Sticking to my veggie practice a yummy plate of grilled veggie salad was placed in front of me. Tomaotes, grilled asparagus, avacado, corn and a leafy green mix it was Nothing exciting and nothing to wow about but between CPK and eating panda, I rather chose the quality over price.

Jumbaliya Pasta is bomb! Shrimp, bacon, sausage and crawfish in a cajun red sauce! BTW the waiter Sergio was on point! Didn't have to ask for refills, napkins or bill! Plus his customer service was top notch!

The hummus starter is really really good. The chicken egg roll start was  second best. But hummus wins by a land slide.Worth getting. I didn't like the white corn guac. Hardly any flavor. My Thai salad was pretty good. I got the half size and that was still a lot. My bf got the rotisserie chicken with garden veggies, it was just a-ok.  Our experience was mediocre. It was funny because we ordered the white corn guac but said they were out, so we ordered the Mac n cheese. But they needed up coming out with the guac saying they were out of the Mac n cheese too.  Overall, it was a meh experience with average flavor/food. I knew why the last time I was at CPK was in high school (ten years ago).

Slow slow slow... ordered steak medium and it came out well done.. they sent it back and it came back well done. This place is a hit or miss. Definitely don't come during dinner unless you and your party have a lot to talk about. Honestly if this wasn't a chain and it wasn't conveniently 1 of the 4 big restaurants then this place would be out of business. Server barely refilled our drinks and came to check on us.

I love pizza and I've been to California Pizza kitchen before..in my prior experiences I haven't been let down but at this specific location was possibly the first. Upon entering it took maybe almost 5 mins to be greeted and then seated and it wasn't crowded nor was there a wait. My waitress was excellent and she provided great customer service and checked in with us multiple times which was great. Okay the pizza, it was good but it wasn't like "wow" & there was definitely lack of sauce.
Great service from Sonia! She was quick and most efficient! We fully enjoyed our lunch, though WE had to rush back to work. Next time we will come to enjoy a relaxing dinner with a Sangria!!

I felt compelled to write this review for the terrible service or, actually, lack of service. The place is not busy at all, and I think customers are catching on the lackluster service here. We were seated close to the other customers, but couldn't understand why none of the servers tended to us for the past 15 minutes. After finally asking one of the servers, it took 5 minutes for us to eventually get up and leave as no one came. There were a few servers standing by the host area, and that annoyed me to a point of speaking with the manager on duty. She tried to convince me to stay and be assured of receiving good service. It was too late. I have had very good experiences at other CPKs, but will take awhile to forget this incident, and may be reserved of choosing CPK as an option among other restaurants.

My daughter loves comming here she likes the pizza and the bread. I usually get the pasta but when we went last time we got the BBQ chicken it was pretty good. the only bad thing wAs I had a short curly hair in my drink :/ I was so glad I didn't eat it loll. Better my drink than my food because i was sharing it with my daughter. Other than that the service is great and the waiter was really nice and helpful also

I called tonight for a pick up order at 7:55 and as I ordered my items she repeated the order back to me and then she said I can do curb side or inside pick up I choose inside.  She said my order would be ready at 8:18 pm when my husband showed up to pick up they said they never received my order.  And they said it's a call center that receives my order and that they did not get it.  I'm so disappointed in them I'm never going back.  The manager was very rude and said you can order it now though.  Do not order to go they won't have your order!!!!!

The food was good I recommend the Caesar salad and the Sicilian pizza but the service is so bad. I went on a day where there was only 4 tables and it took over 20 minutes to get the check that's ridiculous.

We came here after a day of shopping and placed our name for a table for 4.  We were advised that the wait will be approximately 15-20 minutes.  After looking around the dining area, I noticed 6 tables/booths available for seating.  I noticed that both hostess were looking at each other dazed and confused and the manager walking back and worth speaking with them (also dazed and confused).  After waiting for 10 minutes,  we were finally sat at one of the booths that were available from the beginning.  When we asked for a high chair for my 1 year old, the hostess told us that they could not give us a high chair because it was against the fire code on a booth....Then sit us at a Freaking Table!!!  Clueless!!!!! The server was very pleasant (5 stars) and the food was average.

Today i had my daughters 7th Bday here and we were all blown away of the high customer service we received... The manager today was Jesse, super nice informative patient ( we had 14 kids)... Our waitress was khatia ( I believe) she was amazing, handling a group of almost 30 (with kids and parents) our orders kept coming out on time and everything was on point!!! We left her a huge til bc she deserved it very much!!! I will definitely be coming in again and recommending it!!!  Great job guys!!!
The Morroccan  chicken salad is delicious and fresh. Unique combo of beets, dates , marconi almonds and chunky chicken.  Pear and gorgonzola pizza is mmmmmm.

Today I went to have dinner with my son and Samantha our waitress took care of us she was absolutely fabulous she recommended a chicken club sandwich which was out of this world. Samantha thank you so much for everything that you did for me and my son we hope to see you again

I like Pizza! Who doesn't?  We stopped here one night while we were out shopping in the area. This is a nice CPK. There was plenty of seating and there was no wait to get our table. We were seated immediately. Things went down hill after that.  Our server sat us down, he was super friendly. However the service ended up being completely slow after that. I tried to pass it off that maybe there were other tables that we could not see that our server was being slow at coming back to our table each time.  The kitchen staff was able to prepare our food fast. And it was served to our table quickly except for one dish that one of my friends was waiting on. We let her have some of our food since she was waiting for her pasta.  After we were done eating, we actually had to get up and walk tot the bar area to ask if someone would be able to give us our bill to pay, since our server was not coming back around to our table.  Overall the food was good as it usually is when I come to CPK. They offer these new smaller dishes that are the perfect size and price. I even went home with left overs. This was my first time at this location and honestly due to the super slow service I had a hard time giving this a good review. Although that I know that the food is really good quality at CPK.  Maybe I will go back and try this place again. It makes me sad when you get service that is below par.

I been going to California pizza kitchen for years and they been a quick and nice made to grab a bite. I enjoy their selection of pizza and drinks. This location is very convenient to get to. The service is good and the food is always done right.

We came here a few days ago. The place was not fairly busy. Nice crowd of families. The place was clean and not too loud. We were seated in a decent time frame. The waiter was nice and took our drink order. Off to a good start. We get our drinks and then we place our food order. Everyone decided on the BBQ and Hawaiian Pizza. I wanted to try the Chicken Piccata. All set orders placed.  Now here goes to the bad and reason for the one star. Well I'm not sure if they had a shift change or not, but we waited a long time to get our food and the waiter was no where to be found. Empty drink cups! We finally get our food, by another waiter. The pizza crust was burnt and the pizza was also cold. Not hot right out of the oven. Maybe it was sitting?? I asked to have it remade. The pasta was also cold and lacked chicken. It pretty much looked liked a plate of just pasta, sauce and capers. The NEW waiter had an attitude about it. I'm thinking well, I did come here to eat HOT food, not cold and burnt. Last time I checked I was paying for this outing so I would like it my way.  No need to make a big scene. Paid and left.  Not sure if we will be going back anytime soon or in general.

CPK is always a solid choice for good, quality food choices. None of my recent visits challenges that. Salads are fresh, tasty, and they have a great variety to choose from. Pizzas are also top notch, original BBQ is still a classic, delicious and super fresh.  So, why the average rating. Across the board the prices are too high. Way to high. I mean $15 for a salad ($16+ with tax) for a salad that's 75% lettuce. Great salad but for over $16, the value is just not there, not even close. Same with the pizzas, smallish and $15 each.  Also, for in restaurant dining, service is spotty....for what you are paying, service here should always be top notch. It's not, sometimes, just plain horrible.

Somehow I never got around to reviewing this place. I know we come here at least three times a year. It's close by but what also makes it a good deal is that you can buy $100 of gift cards for $80 at Costco.  The food while not extraordinary is good and I've learned through trial and error what I should stick with. I'm a fan of their Jambalaya fettuccine. It is nicely spiced without overpowering. Generous amounts of shrimp, chicken, andouille sausage, and crayfish. I also like their roasted veggie salad. All sorts of grill type veggies. I have learned though that it is not worth (IMO) to add chicken to your salad or pasta. For the extra charge it is not worth it as the portion that comes is small. We once asked and they suggested next time to ask for a chicken breast to be served along with your pasta or salad for an extra charge. My kids like the pizzas of course but not just the plain cheese. This is one of the rare places where they have ventured and ordered say BBQ chicken pizza. Now if I could just get them to order something green on the pizza (cilantro or scallions aside) I'd be purchasing stock. My wife enjoys their lettuce wraps and the chicken tortilla soup.  Today I indulged with dessert, not a norm here. We ordered the chocolate soufflé. It was okay. It's consistency was bordering brownie like. However we also got the salted caramel pudding. We've got a winner here folks! A creamy pudding screaming CARAMEL at you with a crushed cookie bottom. I loved it.  It does get busy but service has always been friendly and attentive. Once my poor child ordered a Caesar salad (the one freaking time she did that on her own) and found some sort of beetle in it. Both server and manager apologized profusely comped the dish and offered her a replacement meal (though she was so put off she declined). I really appreciated that they focused on making sure she was good and talking to her like she was an adult.
Great Pizza, THE Sicilian thin crust is the only way to go!! Amber, for take out, always takes great care of us and makes sure our order is always correct and on time!!
CPK is my go to restaurant on sundays, the staff is always friendly, the place is clean and the food has been excellent! I definitely recommend this place, hands down.
Service was good but my chicken pizza came out so greasy. I know it's pizza but the oil was literally sopping the entire crust.
I come here for the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettucini or the Chicken Tequila Fettucini and for dessert I always order the butter cake. Just deeeeeeeeeeelicious!  Best to come with family!

We loved the food, and we loved Val! (Just want to say that right off the bat in case any of the joking references below are somehow misunderstood.) My wife and I have been to CPK many times and have always been happy.  Last night, we took my mother-in-law to the Otay Ranch (Birch Road) location for the first time.  It looked busy when we arrived, but we were seated right away. Our server was Val, and she was just outstanding (and that's putting it mildly).  We had a running joke going about how awful the food was, and I even ordered the Pumpkin Pie Cheesecake for dessert "to see if it will be equally horrible."  Of course, this was just a joke -- the food was excellent!  I had Cedar Plank Salmon, which was delicious, and my mother-in-law ordered Shrimp Scampi Pizza.  My wife wanted the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettuccine, but without the Fettuccine, since she's gluten-free.  CPK was more than happy to accommodate, and even included extra zucchini (much to my wife's delight). It was when Val came back and saw our empty plates that she quipped, "You must have hated your food," and thus began the whole "awful food" running joke that lasted through dessert.  At one point, I joked that we'd have to speak to the manager and demand a refund, and she deadpanned that she'd have to quit her job so she wouldn't have to keep feeling so bad about serving such awful food. Speaking of dessert, the Pumpkin Pie Cheesecake was awesome.  I highly recommend it. So Thank You, CPK, for a great meal.  And I would like to give an extra special Thanks and shout-out to Val, who was simply the best.  Please make sure she gets recognition for this (and you can tell her that it's coming from the "horrible food" trio -- I'm sure she'll remember us!).  We will definitely be back again for more "horrible food" (LOL).
Much faster service this time. We ordered the kids food first and our food came out with the kids after about 5 minutes! We love the pizza!

Ordered over the phone for takeout.  We had dined in before after a movie at the nearby AMC.  This time we ordered a small pepperoni and 2 carnitas tacos.   Pro tip:  The call center is somewhere in Colorado so if you want an Italian cream soda or anything else that is local to Otay Ranch, then you might want to add on to the order when you arrive. The food was OK but I did not feel the quality matched the price paid.  There are other places that serve better quality pizzas and tacos for better pricing.  The three stars is for the value.  I have read the other reviews but with my experience the staff has been rather cordial and competent.    It is not a bad place per se but not my proverbial cup of tea

My husband and I have been coming to this CPK for 10 years! We love the consistency of the food and alcoholic beverages. Jessie the GM is welcoming and very friendly. I recommend this place if you want to have a nice casual dining experience. Try the BBQ pizza with pineapple, tasty!

I rate 5 stars from my visit on a few days back. 3rd time I've dined there but first time review. I'm a former F&B Director in San Diego and Las Vegas and have been in the business for 35 years. Trust me when I tell you that I'd recommend CPK.  It didn't hurt having a consummate professional server, Cristina, who was bright, menu knowledgeable, and flat out friendly. The other server assistant, Sonia, was very friendly, too. I started with Tortilla Soup and had a Turkey and Brie sandwich. I can tell they do many items from scratch including the honey mustard dressing which was brilliant on the sandwich. They have an open kitchen and I was able to see most of the operation. The cooks work clean, they look professional, and I saw zero health code violations which is unusual in an open kitchen. My son ordered a Hawaiian Pizza but wasn't overly satisfied with the amount of cheese on the pizza. He has eaten here more times than I and said it was different this time. Well, I didn't have to go far as I see Chef Michael table touching his guests checking on every single guests satisfaction. That is so unusual in this business and it's a thing of beauty when the Chef his making his presence known. Chef obviously knows about Guest Retention! He approached and I complimented him on his manner and then told him about the pizza. He apologized and said he'd remake it personally for my son. I was watching him and he had a smile as he remade the item from scratch! He delivered it to our table when completed and it was perfect. I don't know how long the management team has been there but it's working. The GM Jessie was also table touching which is wonderful.  Keep up the great work CPK.
Love it here ! Their service is for the most part the best! Our server was friendly and our food was delicious! We will definitely be coming back soon.

So disappointed in my to go order.   I ordered through restaurants on the run and my order was delivered without any serve wear (plates and forks) or tongs for the salad.      My VICE PRESIDENT was in town and i ordered lunch.  How do you screw up lunch?   So not only did I look bad, so did CPK and restaurants on the run.  When I called ROTR they blamed CPK for not giving them to the driver.    The food was then cold...after I ran to Albertsons to buy plates, forks etc.   epic fail!

Went in for mothers day and surprisingly it was not that crowded, considering my husband and I had already gone to 2 different restaurants and the waiting time was almost an hour. We were seated right away and food was served very quickly. The pesto pasta is delicios so is the bbq chicken pizza. The server was very polite. I will definetly be comeing back to this place.

Came in for dinner with the family. First place I went was to the restroom to wash my hands (very clean) I really liked that the hostess waited to seat us all till I returned so I didn't have to play the find game. We were sat in booth as requested. So far 5 stars!!     We were sat and it took about 7 minutes before we were greeted by our server (mind you the restaurant was half full) finally we were acknowledged and told her would be right with us. After a long day all I was craving was good food and a strong cocktail. Eduardo finally returned to take our order. Simple ... Avocado egg rolls and a apple martini. He came back with waters for the table and about 8 min later our egg rolls came up ... No drinks yet. I was patient and asked another sever " hey can you check on our drinks"? 5 min later almost done with my egg rolls nothing still. I then grew impatient got out of my seat to walk over to the bar to see what was the mystery about my drink. I think he was a manager and I told him I had been waiting for my cocktail for sometime now even pointed out where I was sitting. A couple min later Eduardo came with my drink 3/4 full. This must be my punishment for asking them where my drink was 15 min's after ordering it. The food came out hot and tasteful which is the only reason they are getting 2 stars. There were 2 managers on duty and none came to our table to check on us the entire night. It seems like their time was tied up with a guest next to us for about 20 min. Usually CPK managers walk the floor asking about the food, service and so on. I ordered another cocktail to see if this time it would be different; nope same song. I'm very disappointed with this restaurant tonight. I picked this place due to all the outstanding experiences I've had in the past with this company.  I WILL not be returning here when I'm in the area. I think I will have better service across the way at Buffalo Wild Wings which is really saying something.

I can't remember the last time I ate at CPK. But, it wasn't the best idea to walk out of Nico's and then come here. It felt like Denny's with all the booth seats and yellow accents.  At least, the service here was better! After our server took our order, she offered some bread and butter as we waited. The bread was very plain and not flavored or heated.  Then again, it was FREE so can't complain much.  Service: Our server was super nice, but she dragged at times. We often had to ask her for drink refills and other stuff like crushed chili peppers and Parmesan cheese.  Food: Server suggested I try the Portobello Mushroom Ravioli with BOTH sauces. I was like...whoo hooo both sauces sounds good to me. Yeeaaaah, it was good, but not that great. I could tell that it was microwaved because some raviolis were hotter than others. Plus, the portion wasn't that hefty. I'm a hefty girl that likes huge hefty portions :) Overall, I wouldn't highly suggest this dish.  On the other hand, I would RECOMMEND the Thai Chicken Pizza and Tequila Chicken Pasta dish.   Do NOT recommend ordering the Great White Pizza if you're going to try other pizzas too. The sauce is very subtle and not that flavorful.  Ambiance: As stated, similar to Denny's, but nicer. Very clean and spacious. Good for large parties.

Didn't want to get out of my PJ's kinda night. So we decided to call CPK and order "curbside delivery" and it was really convenient. You call, you wait in the curbside parking spot, they come out and bring you your food. The only downside was they forgot napkins, forks basically all of our utensils.  Ordered: Crispy Mac & Cheese was ok. It needed more of a "BANG" the cheese sauce that came with it also was bland. Don't think I will order this again. Chicken Lettuce Wraps are good. Can't complain. The lettuce was fresh and crispy (not soggy like it's been sitting there waiting to get picked up) Waldrof Chicken Salad was VERY VERY good. Who needed a fork? Not me...

This is my third time orderin from this branch on Otay,  first time orders were on point and time.  Second time i used a gift card but the gentleman in the cashier did not how to use gift card in conjunction with cash. Third time. Order was not started until i arrived to ask for a pick up. not a big deal they apologized and put it ahead of the line and got me out there with in 10-15 mins .  Over all i think they could have done better, but we will see in my next to go order.

Been here several times & still has my interest! Servers are friendly & the decor is well suited for costumers of all ages. The menu is a bit overwhelming at first but once u try a few it gets easier. Food taste's phenomenal! Try the Margherita pizza! Pros: Service friendly, clean baths, food's great, portioned well, take out, military discounts Cons: Service is slow at times, prices are somewhat over inflated Overall, place is still rocking! Keep up the good service!

The service was slow and the restaurant wasn't busy. They shoukd have stuck with the old menu. The new selections of pizza and salad weren't good at all. We had to request menus and no utensils when our food was served, but since we couldn't find our server we had to go grab our own utensils from the bar. We won't be back.

Food isn't bad, but this review is based on customer service. When dining here, my party ordered the Thai Chicken Pizza & my oh my, that pizza was soooo dry! We snooped under the toppings and realized there wasn't any sauce base. When we brought it to the server's attention,  they shrugged it off and said that the pizzas always have a set amount of sauce. We brought it up again to another server and we got the same response. They could have at least had the courtesy to give us their time to look at the pizza... we just munched the cardboard away...

I ate here twice before. I decided to come here yesterday for a late lunch with a friend. Not much of a pizza fan but they had a lot of other things on the menu that sounded really awesome. I opted for the California club and it seriously was so good. The bread was amazing and it just looked pretty. It wasn't falling apart or anything. We got the hummus as a starter and same thing, it was very creamy and the bread was also amazing. I would come back just for the hummus. I recommend this place to all my friends plus the full size bar is an added bonus.

Today was my first visit to CPK and I was pleasantly surprised. We were seated very quickly and the food was excellent! My girlfriend ordered the Jambalaya Pasta and I ordered the BBQ Chicken Pizza with Bacon. The pasta was very flavorful and the pizza was so good I could just eat the bread! The manager even came by and gave us a complementary mushroom on flat bread since we were enjoying our first visit! I could understand why some reviews say the prices are a bit steep, but in my opinion - for the awesome tasting food and genuine hospitality of the staff - it's all worth every dollar. If you're on the fence, I say give it a try! I will be definitely coming back!

My son and family visiting from Las Vegas decided to eat today at this location and even that the restaurant was almost empty, they were sited at the far end corner of the place   The service was really bad, the order for beverages took to long, he order the drinks an food together and took forever to serve them, by accident a drink was spilled and nobody came to help them cleaned the table , he had to do it. He had to stand up to request the waitress to get him the check and he had to stand again to request her to pick the check and she told him that she forgot about it. Those were the only times that they where  attended. What a disappointing experience.

I was not a big fan of California Pizza Kitchen, but after revisiting with a friend I became a fan. We had a very pleasant time and from the moment we entered we were greeted by warm and friendly staff. Because of this treatment and the fact that I did not order a pizza it changed the way I felt about CPK. I didn't have a very good experience the first time I visited some years ago. But like anything else time brings about a change. I just happened to stop by because I was waiting for the movie Noah to start, side note, Noah SUCKED! But that's a review for a different day.
Average. I get the miso salad, it's ok not great. They have good service, but the food is average and it's not cheap

I must agree with most of the reviews here. The service really does suck. My friends, my boyfriend and I ate here on a Thursday night and the restaurant was only half-full. We were seated immediately..that's great, but expected. Our waitress gave us time to decide our orders. She brought our drinks, appetizer and pizza on time too. So far, so good. All this time, she looked bored. I understand if you don't like your job, but the restaurant wasn't even busy. (Note: We ate here during wildfire week, when the air quality still wasn't good. I know, we're so bad.) Even when I asked her to take a picture of my group, she seemed to fake a smile, plus the picture turned out bad! Ok, so maybe that was a rant. My boyfriend and I came back to this location a week later just because we love CPK's pizzas. Service was slightly better than last time, but still not good enough. If it weren't for CPK's crabcake appetizer, BBQ chicken pizza, and Jamaican Jerk pizza (I like this, my boyfriend doesn't care for it), I would just drive further to the Fashion Valley location for the same food with better service.

We like this place! Good food, nice location, great service and decent prices!

This review is for the bartenders and not for the food: If you want to grab a quick drink before a movie or something, this is the place to go. The girls who work here are great! They really know what they're doing, so you won't leave disappointed!

Dude, I don't know what's going on at this location but service is on a rapid downhill decline. Went today and took awhile to get food and then server disappears. Had to stop someone to see what the problem was. It wasn't busy so not sure why it was so slow. Our last two visits have been the same issue. Appreciate the menu additions and changes. Like that you changed to Coke products too. But if the service sucks, what's the point? Spending a lot of money for bad service. Doesn't make us want to return. It's unfortunate because we really like the food. Get it together!

The hostess on Friday night 8/30 was horrible she started a conversation with her employee  before even taking us down to be seated she didn't welcome us or say hi she said "yes" after she was done with her conversation. As if we were inconvenience to her and her personal conversation. And this was actually the second time she had done this. I walked out she was super rude. And didn't even want to accommodate us with my two children kept giving me excuses why we couldn't sit in certain areas. Not going back.

Normally you wouldn't find me yelping about a chain restaurant, because no matter what you say about them they'll always have customers. But in the rare occasion I'll find myself so deeply in love with a place that I must share it with the world.  I can not get enough of CPK's pesto cream penne, rather than penne I replace it with fettuccine, so much that I've had it every weekend for the past month. One weekend I had had it Friday through Sunday and swore 'never again will I eat pasta!' yet I was just there this Saturday chowing down on my favorite dish with a glass of their mango lemonade. *yummm* Some more favorites of mine is their avocado egg rolls and red velvet cake. The avocado egg rolls are stuffed with pieces of chicken, mozzarella cheese, avocado and tomatoes. They're served on a large platter with two dipping sauces: ranch & thousand island (I think). The have a red velvet cake that is too die for! It's so moist and has the perfect balance of white chocolate shavings, and vanilla cream.  I go here almost every weekend and it's great cause this place is never busy.
Can't complain at all!!  I love spicy foods and the Sicilian pizza has just the kick I needed today.  The restaurant want crowded and the Asian plum martini was wire dee-licious!!!  Try it!!

I would like to commend the waiter for his service during my visit. He was very attentive to my request and also thought ahead. He got me re-fills without even asking for them. The food was tasty. I had a Chicken Club Sandwhich which is new. The bun was toasted and tasty. The chicken was not dry, but tasty. The bacon was so delicious. The atmoshpere was calm and cool. Dim lighting. Although I did get stuck coming into through there round about type door like they have in New York. The expierence was great.

So I went here a couple weeks ago for dinner and didn't enjoy it, but recently went here a few days ago for lunch.  My cousins were visiting out of town and wanted to eat here before they went back home.   I have to say this visit was way better.  Our service was ok.  The waiter seemed so bored.  It felt like he was staring at us a lot to see if we needed anything.  I guess its kinda good he was attentive though. I ordered an appetizer for us.  I think it was called the avocado eggrolls?  They were really good.  There was 6 of them, enough for us to each have 2.  Then we all ordered salads.  My cousin got the Thai Crunch Salad which she always orders and I tasted it and it was really tasty.  My cousins boyfriend and I both ordered the BBQ chicken salad.  I got the full one because I was hungry and it was a good sized portion for $12.  I was really full after that.  I'm glad this visit was better.  Makes me want to go back and taste another salad.

Well since it is a chain restaurant there arent to may surprises, its a safe bet. Positives: Its a chain so you know what to expect. The salads come in a half serving which is still a large portion. Pizza is good with some creative options. Decor is very nice, like the bar option. Negatives: The stupid rotating door entrance thing - hate it! Its a chain (but its a step above TGIF's and that stands for a lot). All is all if you want to grab a quick bite of good food for a moderate price its the place to go but if you want something different find something new.

California Pizza Kitchen itself has good pizza's and the pasta's are also OK. I personally prefer the 'mom & pop shop' kinda pizza place,with 'authentic' Italians (that did not sound right!?). Usually I end up in these places following the crowd, but a few times in a lifetime could not harm my reputation. Like I said the food is good and enjoyable if you with the fun people.  This location was kinda busy on a Sunday afternoon, and the service was good and very friendly.  BTW I had the Sausage and Pepper Penne (Penne with slices of grilled spicy Italian sausage, mild onions, red & yellow peppers and Parmesan cheese in our marinara sauce.
