Substitute our Bolognese meat sauce for the marinara sauce upon request).  It was good, tasty and I ate my whole plate, like a good boy does.
OMG! Came here after a bad experience at another restaurant in the mall!!  The drinks were fabulous!  Service great (thank you Mark). Had a few small plates and appetizer!! Will be back!!!

Of course I'd like this place cause I have the best server in the world my friend, Lisa.  Haha so I'm a  little bias.  hehe  I kinda get my own personal helper. hehe  I do like their small cravings menu.  If you don't want to spend so much or eat a lot it's the best way to go.  I do like their pizzas and pasta and I love how you can have them made with a whole-grain crust for the pizza or multi-grain penne for the pasta.  And you have to get a slice of the red velvet cake.  I don't what it is, but their version of this cake is by far one of the best I have ever had.  It's not too sweet and I think it's cause they use vanilla bean instead of vanilla extract which makes the cream cheese frosting even better.  I'd just go there for the cake personally.  This is a great place to eat with friends where it's not too pricey and you can share a lot of dishes.
Consistent good food and service,  whether pasta dishes, pizzas or salads. I'd given five stars but prices are creeping upwards.

I try to order something different in the menu every time i come here and so far everything that I've ordered was pretty good.  Yesterday I tried their tortilla spring rolls.  It wasn't what i expected compared to the ones they serve at asian restaurants.  It was baked!  The crust of their pizzas are good too.  I like my crust crunchy.  Great variety of pizzas.  Service here is sometimes great but there were a few times when we had bad service.

Simply put, there is no bad food on the menu at all. My favorites are the original BBQ Chicken Pizza, and the Garlic Fettucine Pasta w/ Shrimp (if you like garlic, GET IT). The only thing keeping me from giving them a 5 (I have yet to give a 5), is their mixed drink service is severely lacking. I ordered a Mojito, and it tasted like Club Soda with a splash of rum, and a twist of mint. The worst Mojito EVER. If you stick with their beers, soft drinks, or lemonades, you will be very happy.

Yesterday was the second time I regretted going to this location.  The first was almost a year ago and the service SUCKED!  Slow, incompetent and rude were probably the best things that came to mind.  And the food was just o.k.  But it took me a year to get the interest to go back. So yesterday I figured I would avoid the bad service and order to go.  Now both service and food were bad.  Although I know that I took longer than I thought to pick up the pizza so that would explain it being cold.  I'm fine with that, but why it looked dried out and disfigured, I'm not sure.  And then I walked in to pick up my pizza and once the guy realized he wouldn't be getting any tip because I came in, he gave me the charge slip to sign and walked away.  I was just left there holding the slip and pen.  So I had to reach over the counter to place both items somewhere secure. Maybe I'm nitpicking but I was not impressed.  I never have any complaints with the La Jolla location and I have eaten there several times.
I'm full but not satisfied... Californias attempt at recreating pizza has  fallen about 50 yards short...

I have been to CPK dozens of times in Mission Valley, first time coming to this location and after this twlight experience I don't think I will ever return. Only reason 2 stars is because food once we actually got it was really good. Walked in at 12:50 checkout time on check 2:05pm.  Here is what I shared on Facebook: So we walked in no one greets us. Not one employee even looks at you there are like 10 tables sat. We almost walked out when the host walked up. Again didn't say one word to us ask us anything just looked at us grabbed menus and walked towards a table so we followed...He walks away. So we sit and server comes up and she's really nice. Okay so looking up. She takes our drink orders. Brings them back and takes order I asked her superrrrr specific questions about my sons food (has allergies) and she answered so I thought. ANYWAY my husband orders then I order. I got a super simple thing and for once I  didn't alter my entree at all...but it came with a side in the menu it said chips and salsa which was fine but she's like no not anymore. Came with chicken soup or a Caesar salad neither of which I will eat. I asked for salsa or a house salad? Nope wouldn't sub no matter what not even if there was a fee. I ended up asking for no side and she didn't even care. Okay so done there... She leaves NEVER comes back. Someone else brings boys food in like 4 minutes. She never comes back. My sons food is all messed up so he only eats a portion of it that he could. She never comes back. We run out of drinks she never comes back. Not one server even comes near us for me to ask for their help. None of the servers there seem to be checking on their tables you just see them walking around in the background socializing.  Our food never came out. Boys finish their meals. I finally got some random servers attn. Just for more water. The host brings it. Says not one word to us. Here's a great part. This other table is going to leave and the guy stands up and slams his head on the over head lamp not only hurting himself but breaking the whole lamp. Patrons gasp and not one employee even goes to him. Never saw a manager nothing. The bar tender just stares at him and gossips to an employee next to her. The guy just leaves the broken light on the table looks around waits like 5 minutes and leaves. Finally another server comes with our food. We ate. Still noticing no one actually working there is like even friendly or talking to any table (I've been to cpk dozennnns of times and this has never happened). We finish like literally she runs by drops check and is back to socializing with other waiter far away.  I literally just left cash and walked out. The only reason I tipped is because I didn't want to wait for change. ($60.00 on a $51.45 bill)  Weirdest most awkward lunch ever. 4/19/2014  Lunch Server: Andrea

Second time I have dined at this location and I will NOT be making that mistake again. Service SUCKS!  First time I went here the waitress charged my card twice, for different amounts and it took the manager two days to return my call. When I called back that same day it happened the person who took my call must have known why I was calling because they wouldn't put me through to a manager. This happened a while back.  My latest visit (2 days ago) the service was lacking. No refills offered despite the fact that half the restaurant was empty and they were clearly over staffed. Waitress didn't even check on us or offer the complimentary bread. Every other table she served she offered and brought it to. While the bread is nothing special we were starving! And if she's offering it to EVERY other table what made the table that my friends and I were sitting at any different?! It really gets to me when I am nicer and more accommodating than our waiter!  Our table was right next to the register and facing the kitchen- yet no one thought to check on us.  There are too many dining options for people to treat their customers this way. A lot of good places like Niko's closed next to CPK and I am actually waiting and hoping this place does too.  Oh, and the pesto cream penne with chicken my bff ordered- it had 4 SMALL pieces of chicken in it. Pieces were so small she may as well have ordered NO chicken.  Generally I don't yelp about chains, unless the service was exceptional or in this case completely lacking.  *If however you decide to dine here my husband really likes the wheat pizza with extra sauce, chicken and mushrooms. Too bad he won't be eating it again!

Food was good as usual but I felt ripped off with portion size. We ordered 1 pasta bolognese off the kids meal and 1 from the regular menu. It looked like the same portion size!!! We didn't say anything until the end of the meal so our fault for waiting so long, and our server said they could've done something had we complained earlier. we'll probably just order 2 kids meals from now on since they turn out to be the same size!!!!

Now there's a reason why I told myself why I never wanted to come back to CPK. We went here for dinner on Mother's Day knowing how busy it was. My  husband wanted to go to Cheesecake Factory as our first choice, but the 1 hour wait made us turn to CPK since it was close by. Considering it was Mother's Day, a 25 min wait wasn't too bad. However, when we were seated we just got bad service. It took awhile for our server to come by our table and when he wrote down our drinks, we didn't get them in about 5 minutes. Customers who were seated after us got their drinks before we did. Pffft.  I was waiting for our server to give us bread as they have done in the past and still nothing. I was told that we had to "ask" for bread as the servers no longer offer it. WHAT?! Although their bread isn't something special, my kids were starving and wanted something to eat while we waited for our meals. I ordered the garlic cream pasta with chicken and my husband ordered the meat lovers pizza. When we were served our food, I was a bit surprised. Seems like their servings are for kids. My 12 year old ordered the same thing I did and she was still hungry after eating her food. $13 for a small portion of pasta with little bits of chicken is expensive. Especially when you have to ask for bread!  I left the restaurant pretty disappointed. We spent $70 on food that wasn't even worth eating. I don't think I'll ever be returning to CPK and rather spend my money elsewhere.

Tequila lime fetuccine is amazing !! Also this Cpk isn't as packed as other locations !! So if your hungry you don't have to worry about waiting a long time !! The staff was really friendly and frequently come and check on you !!!

The food was good and service was fast nothing was messed up in any way but the reason I am giving 2 stars is strictly based on the server we had. We got there around 830 they close at 930 and after we were finished eating the waiter had come over to ask "Is that it for tonight guys?" We then asked to browse a dessert menu unsure on what to get but definitely wanting a dessert and the waiter immediately answered "Oh sorry we are closed." And sets the bill on the table. Working in a restaurant before I don't understand why you would ask if that's it for tonight if clearly he already had the bill in hand and your food service was closed. If you knew your food service was closing you should come to our table before that and ask us if we wanted anything else before the kitchen closed. Other then that everything I would say was a 3 or 4 star.

I do not remember what the name of the dish was, thanks old age, but it had pasta, spinach, garlic and I added the grilled chicken. It had the best flavor but the pasta was a little over cooked. I personally like my pasta a little more al dente.

We come here so often the servers probably think we have no food at home :)  Everyone there is so friendly & of the 458836453782 times we've been here it's always been great. Jesse the manager is awesome! He always says hi to us & is super nice. I highly reccommend the penne pasta with shrimp & the barbecue pizza.  I had to make a new paragraph for the Piña Colada. I've been to many many places to try piña coladas & NO WHERE comes close to here. Sometimes I go in & just order a piña colada. I highly reccommend it. Don't leave without trying it ! :)

We came here on a wednesday evening and we were seated immediately.  Our server was great as she kept our drinks filled and followed up on as well.  We wanted and ordered the pesto penne cream pasta with shrimp n chicken  but I guess there was a mis communication becuase we just got chicken.  We ordered a half pear gargonzola and scicilian pizza and that came out perfect.  All in all our dinner was great.
Enjoy this restaurant. They tend to you fast and the waiting time for the food to be served is reasonable. Food is very good and I appreciate the great service and smiley faces.
I love their pesto cream penne with chicken and sun dried tomatoes,  their chicken club pizza, and the waldorf salad. Their best server is Katia.
5 words...CARNE ASADA PIZZA WITH AVOCADO!!!

We used the time after Sunday Mass to have a 'family' lunch date... I'm wasn't a big fan of chain restaurants but I have to admit I'm slowly making an exception with this place.  CPK is relatively new to the area (less than a year), I would often pass this place without giving it a second thought...  That's until recently when my daughter was presented an "achievement award" from her school.  It was accompanied with a voucher for a free kid's meal (with a purchase of an adult meal) for the entire month of April.  Cool gimmick but effective (during these tough economic times). Restaurant:  Nice casual experience. a great environment to meet up with some family/ friends.  Alright, I have to forewarn you...  You gotta love the kids in this place!  Kids run free as a bird in this place =)  And it's encouraged...  OMG, no more sugar!  Hahaha! Service:  Prompt and attentive (not pushy).  Manager came by and offered future meal coupons for future visits =) Food:  Wifey & I started with the chips (organic) and Artichoke dip (hearty and flavorful).  Unlimited refills on the unsweetened (house brewed) iced tea =)  We shared a pasta dish with Lemon Chicken and Capers (fantastic).  Daughter had the Mac and Cheese (bland but just fine for her).  Then, we finished our meal with a Chocolate brownie ala mode (vanilla ice cream) with all the fixins' (part of our daughters 'free' meal)...  Just enough for all of us... ...even, if it's simply just for a Sunday lunch getaway with the family.  I think you'll enjoy the experience.  We did!
I've always only order the Waldorf Salad. It's so good!  The service is okay, the establishment is clean, the food is good and service is fast.  That's all I can really say at this time.

This place really doesn't really impress me. The food is mediocre at best. I've given this place several opportunities to redeem it self and every time it falls short. Service and waiters have always been great but who goes to a restaurant just to have great service. If only the food was half a good as the waiters it would give it one more star.
My girlfriend and I stopped by for lunch. She found a metal piece in her pizza. When the manager was informed, he proceeded to charge more for the meal to comp the pizza.... server was great though.

We got take out tonight. The take out service was actually REALLY great, so that's why it gets 2 stars. I think that a restaurant that has PIZZA in its name, should get the pizza right. We just ordered the Original Crust Cheese and Tomato pizza..easy right? We got home, and there was no sauce on it?!? We did not order the White Pizza...and there were clearly tomatoes on it, so there should not have been any mix up. We also got the Sesame ginger dumplings...and those were good, after we warmed them up. We live 2 miles away and when we got home they were cold. Not at all warm. Disappointing experience. Next time we will go to Oggis......

When my bank account feels heavy and I feel like it needs to lose weight from all that money in there, this place is the place to go!  CPK is the weight watchers of bank accounts.  The food tastes great, but it's so damn expensive.  I always think of the starving children all over the world when I go to places like this where a small plate sized pizza costs $14.  We ordered: Asparagus & Arugula Salad Bbq chicken pizza Kung Pao Pasta A&A salad was small and tasted okay, but my girlfriend loves this dish for some damn reason.  It's just asparagus, arugula, Parmesan cheese, nuts, sun dried tomatoes and no chef's sweat in there because it's easy to make this!  you don't need to pay $4 for some salad that leaves a homeless man starving after he eats it.  As for the bbq chicken pizza and kung pao pasta.  Both were great.  Rich flavor and not bland at all.  The pizza had that bbq zing you expect and the pasta had that msg kick.  The kung pao pasta tastes like a high quality Chinese dish that married an Italian noodle.  I like it a lot, but not love it.   As for the service.  The guy was polite and did everything he needed to do, but was obviously computer illiterate.  He said he ran my card twice and it didn't go through, you'd think that they would punch in the number manually, but that's too much brain power required outside of cleaning tables and serving dishes.  Sorry for doing that to you buddy.  Don't want you to strain your brain.  So he comes back and tells me my card is declined.  Well if my card is declined I would have had a notification on my phone and email telling me my checking balance fell under a certain amount.  It was far from it.  I txt BAL to my mobile banking number and it tells me, "Your server is an idiot, tell him to run the card manually and don't give him a tip."  Morale of the story, don't expect your waiters to do anything beyond what they're mentally capable of doing.  I still gave him his tip, but suggest he take extra classes at the community college located near by to help him put some wrinkles on that grey matter of his.

Had dinner with my girl friend and usually have a good time.....BUT I felt like they were rationing diet coke.  Whats up!   I had to ask for every refill we received.  I'm sure if we ordered cocktails or wine the help would have been volunteering to get us more. Remember the magic words are "Its all about the SERVICE" not just food.   CHECK YOURSELVES.

Im a patient person. I worked as a waitress. I understand that sometimes it takes a while to get some drinks, or that its not always the waiters fault if the food is slow or bad. But it is a different story when you dont get service at all.  I went in with my mom, willing to try something new. We were seated and excited as we had heard great reviews about the place. Nope.  We sat there for ten minutes and NOT ONE person came up to us, not even to get us drinks. They were not busy. It was the middle of the day, before lunch. We asked 3 people for drinks but no one got them. We looked around to see if we had to order somewhere or something but sat down when we saw THE TABLE NEXT TO US get seated and served drinks.  After 20 minutes, we asked the hostess if someone was going to served at all and she just said, your waitress will be with you in a moment. Hah! Five more minutes, and we had Paneras. Horrible service, so i cant tell you how the food was.
First time here and I was really impressed with the atmosphere, food and service. I will return.  My husband loves the pizza and the options. Been here twice in less than a month.

This was my first time coming out to Otay even though I've been in San Diego for the last five years. I was surprised by the beauty of the complex this CPK is housed in. Super cute outdoor mall with tons of great shopping and dining options!  A group of 11 of us came on a Friday afternoon and the place was pretty empty (to be expected on a weekday afternoon). We were seated really quickly. Service was good and the food was the same great CPK quality you can always depend on!

I can only comment about the few salads and pizza I had and I always come back for it because I find it to always be great light and fresh! My favorite is the quinoa salad and watermelon strawberry salad!  Service is a bit slow but nothing bad!  It's nice to have a good place near by where we can eat good light food

Rude and discriminatory services against teenagers just trying to eat. I often pick up to-go items with my daughter and son and not once has there ever been an issue- I've always been greeted with excellent customer service. However, since my daughter went there alone, she was treated differently. Will not be going back to your restaurant again.

It's ok. I've had better pizza. Came here for my czn bday dinner.  Service was ok. Waited about 20mins for the Parmesan cheese. Ordered butter cake it was ok too. I've had better desserts.  Service from waitress was good, she was nice and friendly. Mgr came by our table since we flips & so was he, asked where we were from in Pi lol. Super nice! He brought back a cake for my czn.  Then we celebrated & sang HBD! The end.

This is my wife's and my favorite place to eat in the Eastlake area for lunch. To me that is saying a lot because Otay Ranch Center Mall as well as the surrounding area have a long list of places to dine. Been coming here for years. Every time California Pizza Kitchen has consistently brought real good service and food. Having a casual setting. They have indoor and outdoor dining. We have lately ordered the same two things to eat. The Italian chopped salad and the Meat Craver thin crust pizza. The only thing we deviated from our order is our drinks. I usually hate eating thin crust pizza. With the thin crust usually tasting like a cracker with toppings. But not here. The crust is chewing just the way I like it. With the added toppings of pepperoni, sausage, two kinds of ham and salami the Meat Craver is just great. Another thing I am not a big fan of is salads especially salads with garbanzo beans. But again, California Pizza Kitchen prepare it in a way that I truly enjoy eating it. The mustard vinaigrette dressing is tangy but not overpowering so you can taste the other elements of the salad- lettuce, turkey, salami, tomatoes, parmesan and of course garbanzo beans. The pizza and salad just go hand and hand. It's a great combo. Something we love to eat during lunch. I will also recommend their Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. I have eaten it in the past. Delicious. Again real good service. Real good food and drinks. The price to dine is fair. Overall, California Pizza Kitchen is a winner.

Twice a month I go to CPK LOYAL CUSTOMER.... The food is still good BUT WHAT'S GOING ON? The portions are 1/2 the size now! Appetizers and Main dishes, dessert are small too!  I don't like that!  If you're going to serve 1/2 the food reduce the price!   Unless this changes will be going to Cheese Cake factory more! AND WHY DID YOU TAKE THE TIRAMISU OFF THE MENU?  YOU ARE BUMMING ME OUT CPK!!

5 categories with 1 star max each. 1) Customer Service:  Our waitress, Kathia, was great! Attentive and fast. 1 Star + 2) Location: The location is nice and comfortable. Background music not too loud. 1 Star 3) Food: Had their lunch special BBQ chicken with extra onion.  Not good and not bad.  Recommend that you order something else.  1/2 Star  4) Beverage: Unsweetened ice tea with lemon.   Average taste.  The water is unfiltered.  1/2 Star 5) Cleanliness: The place was clean including the bathroom. 1 Star
Ordered to go for the first time today and it was the best customer service I've ever had ! I'm so excited to come back to dine in

Service was good and waitress attentive. The food was just "OK". Several years ago this place was unique but now just seems over priced with few healthy options. Most HALF salads are almost 1000 calories dripping in oils etc.
I love coming here. My food is always amazing and the atmosphere is the best. Their drinks are great as well. Definitely recommend the Moscow mule when you have the chance.

I haven't been here in a while. I used to eat here often and the food and service used to be great. The last few times I visited, the food was horrible and the service sucked. Food was barely warm and it was hard/stale. My last visit was on a night that was slow. Only a few people in the dining area. The food took forever to arrive, I had to ask for a water refill (which took a long time) and we sat there with empty dishes for a very long time before the waitress brought our check. Definitely not going back. Used to be good, but no longer.

This is a great place to eat! My wife and I love their buffalo cauliflower dish and their asparagus and arugula salad. But mostly, we've had the pleasure of being served by two great people on our many visits: Javi and Sonia. With their professionalism and friendliness, we feel at home when we eat here. Thanks so much guys!

I'm not a super fan of CPK but we were in the Chula Vista area and I was craving a delectable salad. Boy was I pleasantly surprised with the great experience at this location. Our server was Tamara who was super sweet and attentive, we couldn't have had a better person attending our table. Items ordered where: Peach Lemonade, Agave Mojito, Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings, Chicken Milanese plate, Roasted Veggie half plate salad, and a California Club Pizza. The drinks were very yum, the appetizer was delish, but the star's of the meal were the Chicken Milanese and the Roasted Veggie salad. Overall a home run, thank you CPK for your great customer service.

I am a weekly customer here with my family. I am giving today's visit a 2 due to the service of KATIA. I arrived to check in at the front desk, KATIA then told me I had to wait until a family of 4 walked in to the restaurant. Mind you they walked in after me..... NOT COOL KATIA! NOT COOL!

I enjoyed my experience here. I had the jambalaya fettuccine and it was pretty close to perfect. It was well seasoned and they didn't skimp out on the shrimp. I'm so glad I ordered it. I had the sangria also and it was so refreshing with the mango flavors. There was a bit of a wait but nothing out of the ordinary. Our server was attentive. I was given a gift card for Christmas and I'm definitely going to put it to good use.

The service at this place in Otay Ranch continues to disappoint. We were sat on a Friday night at 7:30 when restaurant about 2/3 full, for 15 min no one approached our table until i got up and walked to the wait station where servers chatted and complained about their evening. Food was ok, but I continue to wonder why they only operate at less than 50% energy.... At the end of my meal when paying the bill, server asked "do you want to speak with the manager about the wait and inconvenience"...seriously?

I've been here about a handful of times and I've always had an okay experience eating here. The food is good but I feel like it's a bit pricey for what you get. We ordered the Asian crunchy salad and the Pulled pork habanero pizza as well as the jambalaya pasta. The salad was the best part of the meal. The pasta was okay I wouldn't order it again..the noodles were undercooked and the flavor of the dish felt like it was lacking something. The pizza was good but nothing special it came with habanero sauce on the side which wasn't spicy at all it tasted a bit watered down. The only reason why I come here is because it's conveniently in the mall. The ambiance is nice though

The first time I came here I was impressed. The second time I came here was about one month later. That should let you know that's I couldn't stay away for too long.  The atmosphere is great the food is great the service is top notch!  I recently had a salad with their AMAZING HOMEMADE DRESSING. This stuff is so good that I requested it be bottled so I could take it home. To my surprise they actually sell it and gave me two bottles I paid $4 for 2 bottles the bottles themself cost a $1 at a dollar store so basically I paid $2 for two full bottles of their dressing which is COMPLETELY WORTH IT!!!!!

I've been to other California Pizza restaurants and the other ones have better service and food. The only thing that tasted good here was the pizza. The soup and salad wasn't great. Plus our server was on snail pace. She even picked her ear while taking our order. Who wants to eat after seeing that?! She didn't even offer to refill my water like she did at other tables. Not cool. The only good thing was the supervisor  or manager who came around was nice. I had to ask him for the check since our server disappeared.

One Word: Velvet CPK, a chain restaurant that I've eaten at in other cities. Nothing new. But, always tasty. At this location I've had the same male waiter on several occasions, too bad I don't remember his name. Always a friendly guy, with a quirky personality who is very attentive. I was only recently introduced to the Carne Asada Pizza, which I was apprehensive about trying in the first place. Carne Asada + Pizza = ???? In reality, this is now my staple pizza that I always order!  Tender carne asada complimented by tomatillo salsa on that same tender & sweet crust.  Oh...carne asada how I love thee! Part 2 of 2 to new introductions @ CPK includes the Red VELVET cake. My cousins & I had this piece of heaven w/vanilla bean ice cream. 4 girls armed w/spoons devoured the dessert. That cake had no chance to sit, gone in 5 mins. I thought it was a fluke that the cake was so moist & perfect.  But, 3/3 times that I've had the cake, it has always been the same. Moist and decadent!

I came in the other day with my sisters and the service was amazing! I used to work at a restaurant and I know the feeling of getting sat a table of teenagers and I feel like when we go out to eat servers tend to think that of us because we look young. My sister might look like she's in high school but she's really 25 and also worked at a restaurant! Anyway the food was delicious and our server Sergio gave us great customer service. He was friendly, quick at getting the food in, and super cute. Thanks CPK, keep it up!
Brian your the best server! everything came out perfect .... thanks for making our dining experience hella bomb!

I've been here twice and haven't been very impressed. The first time I went the service was decent. The second time was bad enough to make me not want to come back. Our waitress came up to my friend and I within a minute of us sitting down wanting to know if we were ready to order. We told her no, but that we would like some waters. She got our waters within a minute and was back asking if we were ready to order again. Our answer was the same: no. When our food came I wasn't impressed. The peach salad I ordered didn't taste half as good as the menu made it sound. To make matters worse - the employees were using the table behind us as a break table. One of the workers kept bumping my friends chair. Once our waitress left our check, she would walk by every couple minutes checking to see if we had paid so she could pick it up. Keep in mind that this was around 9pm and the restaurant was not very crowded. After about 20 min or so, she came back and said that her manager told her to get our check so she could clock out. Are you serious?? I have never had that happen to me at a restaurant especially more than an hour before closing. On top of this, both my friend and I felt like employees kept looking at us like they were ready for us to leave. This was enough to make me feel like I won't be coming back here. The mediocre food and service is not worth it in my opinion.

A laid-back, modern feel to get some good pizzas and pasta. It's an awesome place to go to just lounge and talk with friends. I went during lunch time and it wasn't that crowded, we got seated fast. Our waiter was cool, average, he attendedt to us regularly.  My sister and I shared the avocado wrap which amazing! I highly recommend it as an appetizer and for my main course I had the lemon chicken with spghetti. A little too sour but it was good nonetheless. They gave me three good sized chicken and it was soo good. They gave more that I expected. Don't get mad though, I'm not much of a pizza eater and since this is what the restaurant is known for, I apologize for not being able to review a pizza, haha.

No where near as busy as the Fashion Valley location, which is a good thing... because no one likes to wait, just ask any girl taking a pregnancy test. Anyhow... back to CPK--good food, good service, nice atmosphere. Try the thai crunch salad or the wild mushroom pizza on honey wheat. Enjoy your meal! Especially if you're eating for two. Mmmmhmmm.

I absolutely adore this place.. I'm surprised to see any complaints about the service. We came in last night with a party 15 and our server was delightful, she was calm and patient with my elderly mother and her accommodations. The food was great, I had the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine, and had a slice of my husband's Thai Chicken Pizza it was great. A little disappointed to see any negative feed back. My experience was excellent!

Skip this place and go to dominos. Service is horrible and food is overpriced. $42 for 2 small pizzas and a kids pepperoni pizza is wrong. Waiter went on his lunch without telling us so we were just sitting there, we were lucky another waiter notice like 20 minutes later and helped us out. I don't get it don't these people know you get tipped on service. I have never in the past 15 years of eating out not left a tip until I came here, and I'm not a tight ass too I usually tip 20% even with mediocre service but this was ridiculous. This was my second time here, which reminded why I never wanted to come back. Anyways overpriced food and bad service that sums it up.

Located super close to the AMC theater entrance. Ate here after a movie. Interesting pizza selection. Crust was above average. They have what appeared to be a full bar. I like that they have a guarantee to encourage you to try something new. If you don't like it they will give you something you know you like. Got seated in a booth quickly and waiter was friendly. Not the greatest pizza in SD but a nice after movie option. The cold left over slices were also still tasty. Will be back but in no rush.

Even at odd hours, this place gets pretty packed. Still, one can easily block out the crowd noise with an instant seat at the bar and a quick martini. The food here is pretty good, as is the service--despite the new staff working out its kinks. I didn't notice any major faults, but that may have been the effect of my second drink. Nevertheless, I stand by my assertion and I really believe that my Chicken Milanese would have been just as delicious had I been sober. Prices are only "okay." I've had more bang for my buck at other places, but only here can I be assured that there will be a seat waiting for me right away... albeit at the bar.

I used to like CPK, or is it that I like CPK, just not THIS one? The 3 times I've been here the service has been...slow, inattentive, bored, and at times apologetic (to themselves or us, I'm not sure)...and it's not that new anymore! After being seated by the hostess (who upon noticing patrons were approaching, searched left and right for a place to hide before greeting us) we waited for our waitress to arrive, which she did within a reasonable time.  We ordered our beverages and an appetizer. The appetizer we chose where the tortilla rolls, thai chicken and mediterranean chicken. My advice, skip these. Ugh. I decided to have my Waldorf Chicken Salad and my husband got the Hawaiian pizza. Both were prepared well, as expected. What kills this location is the service, and I don't know if this stems from management or the quality of the staff. If you're stopping in for a drink before a movie, you'll do fine, but for eats, check out the other places, where the staff are more likely to want to see you. (Of if you must have CPK, go to Carmel Mountain Ranch or La Jolla).

Well I went to this place for the first time thinking it will be pretty cool. Well as it turns out, I'll never go there again. Pizzas are pretty small in size, they're only 6 small slices (3 bites) and not the best pizza I got half pepperoni half sausage. For 2 adults and one child it was 70 bills and the pastas are small portions no soup no salad. Also, the service was really slow eventhough it was not busy at all. I wouldn't recommend this place at all.

I went to CPK for the first time and i was very satisfied! I really liked the way the restaurant was decorated and you can see them prepare and cook the pizzas in the woodfired ovens. LOVE IT! The Chipotle Chicken pizza is BY FAR the best pizza i've ever had ! It's spicy and they say its the spiciest thing on their menu but it has such good flavor!!!! :) The pasta is good too. I will definitely be coming back!

I like coming here. The staff and manager are very nice. Today was great especially. Our orders came first and we waited for our daughter's food for a few minutes.  Later the head chef came to our table and asked how's everything so of course we said  everything is good but he said "no I know it's not good coz your daughters food came out late so we will take care of it." isn't that wonderful! You know that they are serious about making their customer happy! I mean we really didn't wait that long for her food and she ate free!
CPK's pizza is shitty, where's the sauce? But their pasta and dessert is good. I would rather hit up more authentic pizza joints. Waiter took forever.

I used to love their Thai linguine so that's what I had today and it was TERRIBLE. DRY DRY DRY. Obviously the chef didn't use enough peanut sauce that the pasta tasted like peanut flavored yakisoba or something. Don't be cheap on the sauces, chefs.
The only chain restaurant I enjoy, and I really enjoy it!  Great food, good service, and convenient location!  Try the new tomato/asparagus pasta, light and tastes great!  Great beers on tap also.

I came here with a girlfriend on Friday night. Let me take a moment to say that I have usuals when I go to a restaurant. I'm scared to try new things because I don't like being disappointed. My usual at CPK is a strawberry lemonade, chicken BBQ chop salad and BBQ chicken pizza. If I have extra cash in my wallet, and more people in my party, I'll also order the kung pao spaghetti. That's it! Friday night was simply forgettable. We order the spinach artichoke dip, which was good. Then we order the Thai salad-thing. It sucked ass! Major 'effin ass. It was a plate of lima beans! Very little lettuce, dressings, etc. We also ordered the BBQ chicken pizza, which is always fab. I go to CPK when there is no where else to go.

I've been here four times in the last few months and it's never been a great visit.  All of my visits have had slow, inattentive service.  Last night was by far the slowest.  I was in a party of 8, and the restaurant was steady - not slammed, just steady.  Unfortunately, we got a new server that struggled through the whole process.  She was pleasant enough, just very new to her job as a server.  We were there for 2 hours.  It was about 20-25 minutes just to get the drinks to the table, another 10 minutes to have her come take the order, another 35 minutes to get the food out, we ate, then it took another 30 minutes to get the check.  I talked to the manager because I felt trapped in the restaurant without my bill.  He apologized and hurried the process along.  I went to pay and he put the entire bill on my credit card, even though my ticket was only for my party of three.  Now it's another few minutes to solve that problem.  Agony. The food last night was very good.  We had a Thai Crunch Salad and a Penne and Pepper dish with Bolognese sauce.  Both were delicious.   I also had a bite of a friend's Chicken Fettucine with Garlic Cream Sauce - awesome!   I've had the pizza here - it's not even close to the quality at Sammy's Woodfired Pizza.  On other visits I've the Classic Ceasar (Bland), Goat Cheese and Roasted Pepper Pizza (Bland), Sweet and Spicy Italian Sausage Pizza (Bland and undertopped), and the TriColore Salad Pizza (Weird).   If you go here, expect a longer than average service experience, and stick with the pasta - that's the best thing I've found at CPK.

pros... usually seated quite quickly cause not many people in the place.  at least when my wife and i went here last.  the food was pretty ok.  i ordered the hawaiian pizza, which is basically a pepperoni pizza with pineapples.  love it, cause it's like $2 cheaper then a regular pepperoni pizza, imagine that, you get something more for less.  wife ordered some salad, enough said.  iced tea was decent.  really liked the dessert, red velvet cake, hmm, made our dining experience almost pleasant.  cons... the service here is completely sloth like and so dour, sour and unpleasant.  upon entering the place, the super skinny lady with the glasses and really long hair, really tried to hide or leave her post, or at least it appeared this way from the revolving door.   and then when we do get in, she is not the least bit interested in our arrival.  no smile, or hi welcome to CPK, nothing!  oh no must mean hard work ahead, like getting two menus and looking for a place to seat us, then walking to that place to seat us.  then it also means talking to us about the specials for that day, blue crab cakes and something else while placing the menus on the table.  come on now, doesn't sound that hard does it?! luckily our server was a bit more happy to see us.  but not by much.  she was pleasant enough and even cracked a smile when we joked with her.  really she was much better, when we got to dessert she even said the choice we made was a good on and giggled too. and she did put a nice big smiley face on our bill.  that was nice.  thanks for paying, thanks for coming in and eating our food, thanks for enduring our super bummer attitude.  no thanks don't there were coming to this one anymore!

The originator of the BBQ Chicken Pizza. And I like how you can substitute the crust with honey wheat. Good stuff right there. 4 stars from me. =) My star rating went down because of their 'new' thing - individual appetizers. We tried the guac & chips and the crispy mac & cheese. Yea, they said individual, but they're so tiny for about $4 each plate. I think that's just overpriced. The crispy mac & cheese was pretty flavorless too. At other restuarants, $4 appetizers can get you so much. I mean c'mon. Down to 3...
Never disappointed; tried their guac for the first time and loved it had corn and peppers in it but wasn't spicy at all.

The five stars if for the great food. (Service is pretty good, but nothing that stands out) I come here quite a bit when i am craving my favorite WALDORF CHICKEN SALAD. Dont be fooled by the fact that its a salad. It is loaded with tender chicken, candied walnuts, grape halves, celery, and fetta cheese and the best dressing to get with it is BALSAMIC VINAIGRETTE.  There is parking right in front of the restaurant and its near the mall so it's perfect if you are planning to head to the movies after, shopping, book-reading at barnes, etc. Great location and cariety of food.

I have no complaints about this restaurant. The food is really good, service is always great, and prices are reasonable. Sign up for their rewards card for deals/discounts. The restaurant is always clean and you get a nice view of the kitchen so you can see what is going on. I personally prefer takeout, and I have never had any issues.

I have never had a "wow" experience at ANY CPK in particular. I have never said, "hey, let's go to CPK!" - with that said, I haven't been to a CPK for about.... 6 years. So when my friends wanted to go there for dinner, I thought I'd give it a fighting chance.  Our group of six were greeted by a young front door hostess who hurriedly went to get a table ready for us. She seemed a bit nervous or flustered with our large group because she couldn't give us an estimated wait time. We were seated within 5 minutes, so plus points. Once we were seated, our drink orders were taken right away and our dinner orders shortly after. THEN... the wait... and more waiting. I understand it takes longer for a larger group to get their orders, but all our drinks were more than half way finished and we didn't even receive any BREAD to munch on! parties, large and small, who were seated after us all got bread and butter. My friend pointed out, "Maybe you just have to ask for bread?" Ok, fine, maybe they're trying to be bread-conscious and serve bread to those who ask for it... but honestly... i haven't been to CPK in a while, if this was my FIRST experience with CPK and I didn't know i had to ASK for bread and i saw others getting bread, i'd be ticked! AND I WAS! What they SHOULD do is ask if we would like bread while we waited for our dinners. I asked for bread and we got it promptly. I'm not sure if that's really their policy but it sucks. They should just ask their customers if they want bread instead of having us ask for it ourselves. Anyway, their only saving grace is that their pizzas are pretty good. I got the California Club and my bf got the Jamaican Jerk. They were both pretty good, however I wish I had some kind of ranch sauce for dipping. Their pizzas are on the dry side - not much sauce. Another minus was that our waitress asked on ONE occasion for ONE person out of our 6 person group if he wanted a refill. As for the rest of us, we had to repeatedly ask for refills. Even asking for a refill she got one out of three cups and then forgot about the other two. We had to remind her to get us more refills. Well, CPK you lose. you failed to redeem yourself despite your pretty-OKAY pizzas. it wasn't enough to overcome the poor service, bad bread policy (if there even was one - maybe she just forgot to give us bread?), and overpriced menu.

It's our tradition Friday night date spot. We always go and either get the same delicious pizza's or if we're feeling crazy we'll try something new. We always have great service and everything is always brought out timely. What we can't live without and gets us going back each week- the Avocado Club Rolls and Spinach and Artichoke Dip! Both are absolutely delicious. Especially the different sauces for the Rolls- OH MAN!! As for pizza, we've tried many. I've seemed to always go with Five Cheese and Tomato (YUM!!!!) and he always tries something new, but out of all, his fav is the Sicilian so far. We try to either go before 4 or after 8/9. Parking is ridiculous in that parking lot (between other places to eat and the movie theater), it can get obnoxious to drive around for 20 minutes and stalking those walking out to their car (awkward!). All-in-all- Great stop! Definitely recommend!
Idk why everyone is giving cpk bad ratings there pizza, pasta, and salad are really good. But I have to say they have pretty weird waiters and waitresses.

Once again the half star system is needed on YELP. 5 star taste on pizza, but expensive - here is definatly a case of high quality and getting what you pay for.   Service was OK.  Nothing exceptional yet consistant! The cost is a deterent but it was good.

3.5 stars would have been more appropriate but... I'm no longer convinced the Saturday wait and price was an even exchange for the service and food I got on my last visit...  It's been a long time since I have visited a CA Pizza Kitchen (10 years?), and where I don't mind paying a few extra bucks for better food/service, I'm not convinced I got either this time.  Since I had so many good experiences with them back in the dy, I'll probably give them another shot hoping this trip was out of the norm.  Their Margherita & BBQ chicken pizzas are some of my all time favorites so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.
Very nice place to eat dinner.not loud and the staff is very friendly.recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice place to have dinner

Ended up eating here since we walked out of the horrible service at Buffalo Wild Wings. We were sat down immediately and within minutes our drink order was taken. Our drinks arrived quickly and we placed our order. Food came exactly as ordered and was delicious. Our waitress Leigh was very attentive and checked in with us a few times. We will be coming back more often.

CPK may not be the greatest pizza, but I wouldn't know because I don't go there for their pizza... The thing that keeps me coming back is their split pea soup. I know, it may sound strange, but after you try a bowl, you will understand why. It is also made without bacon, so all you vegetarians out there can enjoy it as well.  Their salads are also pretty fresh and tasty. You have to have some serious issues to f up a salad.

This is is solid for good eats.  Their Thai Chicken pasta is my favorite, as well as their Thai Chicken pizza.  The works never fails either.  My kids love eating here as they have a good selections on their kid menus.   Service is hit and miss.  Waiters are friendly and a bit goofy, but their attentiveness isn't always there.  I still like stopping by from time to time though.
The manager Jess  takes very good care of us when we go there. We really like the chipotle pizza and tostada pizza as we got tired of the regular pizzas we ate outside of CPK!

Last week I visited this place and I was happy with the service and food. Manager came and greeted us personally. I thought this was a good touch. Food came pretty fast. We ordered the new Margarita Pizza's and they tasted delicious. over all I really recommend this Place. Most of the good experience came with actual eye contact of the waiter who did  go extra mile to get us bread and crushed red peppers excetera. Wait time was very less. I'll revisit this place again in my next trip.

I have eaten here many times, and am wondering why you don't? CPK... you get very good, very tasty food.   Here are a few of my recommendations: 1. Ask for whole wheat dough for your pizza. Anything with different kinds of cheeses will work for you! The pizzas are truly mouth watering. *Caution: split the pizza too.. or you're end up eating the whole d$%m thing! 2. Split a salad! The salads are wonderful and the portions are very generous, even for the 1/2 size. The chicken waldorf is my favorite. The tastes and textures here are devine! Get the dressing on the side &/or ask for the low-fat/fat-free kind. 3. If you want soup, you can do half & half! The soups are yummy. If you're looking to just hang out and order a few appetizers and drinks. The place has a cool, laid-back feel. The drinks are good. They do get a little busy on weekends so don't hesitate to flag down your bartender, server, etc! Your food will also take a little longer, but it is well worth the wait. Note: I wouldn't come here for their "other" dishes: pasta, seafood, etc. If you want seafood go to King's next door, go to an Italian place for your pasta, and if you want a place where EVERY sort of thing is delicious... CHEESECAKE FACTORY! =)

I placed an order this evening for pick up and am highly disappointed.  I have never experienced bad service at this restaurant until today.  I ordered specialty pizza, chicken lettuce wraps, and a kids meal.  Everything came out, but when my food was delivered to my car I asked for more lettuce and the waitress didn't bring me more.  In my online order I stated four people were eating and only three pieces of lettuce were given for all of us to share.  We also did not receive the sauce that accompanies the lettuce wraps.  The bread that came with our order only came with three pieces.  I can't believe this happened especially since we always visit this location.  Needless to say I'm just not sure if we'll be back.

Good service, terrible value. Ordered carry out here and they were 25 minutes late with our food. Pizza was cold and is the size of the $5.99 jobs at a Dominoes. The Waldorf salad was good and reasonably-sized. We got four tiny pieces of sourdough.

The food is good - avocado club egg rolls are a must have and the garlic chicken pizza is yummy.  I am only giving 3 stars because the service was ok and when I asked for a box for my pizza she took the pizza back to the kitchen and never brought it out to us - I only remembered the next day that she did this :(

It's hard to go wrong with this place.  The service is often hit and miss but the quality of the food is always at least above average if not great.  A great restaurant to visit when you can't decide what exactly that you are hungry for.

I don't think I've ever had a bad experience at any of their locations but this one is always very accomodating and the food is good. I think they have a wide enough variety of foods to allow one to eat something different depending on what they're craving. I love their pizza dough...usually I end up leaving a lot of crust behind but their's is almost sweet?? and I love it!

service was OK, and the food is a bit above average. maybe my standard for 5 stars is too high.many reviewers had complained about bad service, and i somewhat agree but i had worse (ie see my review on Saigon). i like the Thai chicken pizza.

Whenever I look for a restaurant my primary concern is with value. It doesn't have to serve the cheapest meal in town, but I need to get good value for my hard-earned dollar. I consistently find that at California Pizza Kitchen located at the Otay Ranch Mall. I generally alternate between their Ginger Salmon and their thin crust Margherita Pizza. They provide a generous slab of salmon which I enjoy with their grilled asparagus and spaghettini with creamy lemon caper sauce. The portions are so large that I sometimes have a hard time finishing it all. Coming from the east coast my wife and I know something about good pizza. While CPK's pizza doesn't taste exactly like the east coast variety, it is equally good. We always include a large field of greens salad with our meal. The salad includes various types of lettuce and spinach, sliced pears and candied walnuts. We love that too. CPK's manager Jessi, has done an excellent job of selecting servers that are helpful, friendly and attentive. Today's server, Brian, was a perfect example. Overall, CPK is just a well-run establishment and one that we visit often. We never leave disappointed.

The last two times I've been to CPK have been very pleasant. Both occasions our server was Daisy and she was very nice, helpful and would check on us occasionally. While waiting for our order, they give us complimentary bread with a side of virgin olive oil.  Unfortunately I don't like pizza, so I come here for the pasta. I get their Garlic Cream Fettuccine, which consists of garlic parmesan cream sauce with fresh Italian parsley. I also add chicken which is an additional $3, but I don't mind, because they serve a big portion. The prices for their meals are a fair amount, just like any other restaurant.    Overall my experiences at CPK were excellent and would definitely come back if I'm ever craving their pasta.

Always liked food at CPK. But I noticed how they reduced the portion size Of their food.   Service 2/5 Food 4/5 Portion 1/5 We used to go there a couple of times a month, the whole family. We won't be stopping there again.

Well, I took my wife and son for dinner tonight, 8/6/2017, around 6pm.  I don't even know where to get started.  First of all the table they sat my wife my son and I was dirty, even the floor had all kinds of food on it. I asked them to put us on a different table.  Then we waited for a while before we saw our waitress, the place didn't seem that busy, but she seemed very ocupied and in a hurry.  She took our order which it took a while for our food to arrive.  She brought bread with olive oil,  but my son wanted butter which are had to wait a while to see her and order the butter. Which arrive arrive the same time as my son's pizza. My salad was okay, my wife found an ant on her pasta plate which she reply "I don't know how to react to that" Very poor customer service to say the least! . When we got the check my wife notice that our macaroni and cheese appetizer had never arrived,  which she said "don't worry I will take it off the bill as if she was doing us a huge favor. We has visited this place couple times before,  and food was decent with average customer service.  But this time, everything went wrong, my wife and I tried our son's pizza and it was like a piece of cardboard,  no taste no flavor.  It will be a very, very long time if and consider going back, and/or referring anyone to try this place.

I normally LOVE cpk!!! But I went last Saturday ordered some apps and the bbq chicken pizza. Our egg rolls had hair in them and the pizza was undercooked. I don't know, mistakes happen .... I alerted our server who took away the food, she acted kind of insulted. I felt awkward bringing it up but I'm sorry I'm a germaphobe and I'm not trying to eat a pizza that the crust isn't cooked all the way through. The manager came to the table trying to be chummy with a lame excuse. He said the hair had to have been from a brush because they brush them with butter. Really? There was no butter flavor nothing ...... um. I'm not buying it. The icing on the cake was when he told me to look over at the guy at the bar who was bald and say he's the cook it couldn't be a hair..... I'm sorry but that's the bartender. I'm not a fool. I left and will never go back.

This was the first time I have ever been to CPK. I actually have never heard of this place before, but we were given a gift card for Christmas. The staff was very friendly & we were seated pretty quickly. It seemed like it was starting to get a little busy after we arrived, so we were understanding with our server not getting to us quickly to check our drinks for refills. Her friendly & helpful attitude more than made up for it, & kept the evening pleasant. We got the spinach artichoke dip for an appetizer, along with the free bread to start with. Followed by a hand tossed margherita pizza, and hand tossed carne asada pizza, to share as a family, and a kids Hawaiian pizza & fruit for my son. Everything was so delicious and filling. Well I can only take my husband & daughter's word on the carne asada pizza since I'm allergic to onions & cilantro tastes weird to me, but they say it was delicious. We had a great experience & will definitely be back some time in the future. I wish I could remember our server's name (but I suck with names). She was so friendly & just great.

I've always loved California Pizza Kitchen, but back when I used to eat chicken I would get the barbecue chicken pizza which was so good! They have so many different options for vegans and vegetarians on the menu so I can still enjoy this restaurant! There were some buffalo cauliflower appetizers that we got and they were so delicious! I probably could have eaten five of the appetizers by myself! If you're at California Pizza Kitchen and you're curious what they taste like, order them you will not be disappointed! It's like a healthy chicken wing. Hahaha! The service here is always great, the drinks are good and always refilled in time, and the staff is very friendly and attentive. The restaurant is always very clean also!

Came in for lunch with my girls got seated right away server was prompt and courteous. Had the pizza and salad lunch special for 12 bucks. The pizza was good the salad was also good however could have used more dressing. Felt the price was a little high for what we got but other than that good service and good food not great but good.

ABSOLUTELY LOOOVE THIS PLACE!! I have only had it twice but the first time my husband and I sat down. The seating was fast and the staff was friendly and the for the wait time it was accurate giving the fact the restaurant was packed!. That is always a good sign of great service and fantastic food options  my FAVE THE CARNE ASADA PIZZA!!!!!!, cauliflower buffalo its literally taste like a buffalo wing with crumble of blue cheese n celery it's delicious as it melts away when u eat it . I RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT TO ANYONE WANTING TO HAVE A GREAT DINNER WORTH EVERY PENNY, in my opinion.

location: Chula Vista, San Diego, United States
review: Sometimes I forget that this "mall" has a CPK, but from time-to-time, I dine here for a specific craving: pasta. It has never occurred to me (until today) how lackluster their customer service is, which is surprising to say the least because they are not at all busy, ever. Even the host took me and boyfriend to our table in a blasé, zombie-like fashion. Despite the fact that their service has lowered over the past couple of years, their food satiates my carb desire. I think my favorite pasta is the garlic fettuccine alfredo with chicken, but I enjoy their tequila chicken fettuccine, as well as their pesto chicken penne. I do think they need to lessen on the oils, because it tends to get a little too greasy. Also, I can't forget their caesar salad, which is probably one of my favorite caesar's.  It amazes me how above average their prices are for such an average restaurant. Their price range for certain items goes hand-in-hand with The Cheesecake Factory, but these two restaurants are definitely not on par with one another.

I cannot get over how bad CPK  has become.  In the last two months we have three bad experiences.  Called for take out for our daughters.  They leave to go pick it up.  Cpk calls me and says they can't cook anything.  Kitchen issue.  Why did they take the order?  Second incident a week later.  Our favorite menu items are gone.  I'll give them a pass as that's corporate.  We go back today.  We waited so long for our food to be served.  When it arrived my Blt pizza was inedible.  Burnt and the crust was like a cracker.  I realize they serve a cracker crust but not for this pizza. My daughter's cheese pizza was the same.  My other daughters"s  pizza had chicken on it Which was like rubber.  We won't be going back until they fix this.

We called ahead asking for the expected wait for four people the hostess said 20 mins. We arrived three mins later prepared to wait. The place was empty we scratched our heads to why she said 20 mins but moved on. We then order the garlic chicken pizza was not that good. We then waited 10 mins for a box and then 10 mins for the check and it was dead agsin a head scratcher. The waitress was nice but service was satisfactory at best.

Surprisingly they were not crowded for the Veteran's Day free lunch. Will probably go back next year since it's close to me and we thoroughly enjoyed the  pizza. Hadn't been to a CPK in quite some time. We tried the Italian chopped which was definitely lacking something....we decided it needed pepperoncini. Priced at over $15 but free for Veteran's day we thought it was a little too spendy. The pizza on the other hand is priced at around $15  but really tasty. We got the sausage pepperoni and mushroom which had a good amount of cheese and toppings and the crust is not oily at all. While wine seemed a bit pricey at over $10 for a 9oz pour, our server was great. Besides getting our entrees comped for veteran's day, we thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary hot bread that was served with an herb EVOO...yummm.

I'm only rating the gluten free pizza we bought here. I wasn't happy with the price when compared with the gf pizza at Project Pie and disliked what I saw here at double.  The taste is far better and doesn't seem like I'll have the same methane output. Project Pie gave me lots of gas.

location: Chula Vista, San Diego, United States
review: Food was good! Service was excellent! Sam was our server and she was on top of it!! Butter cake was amazing!! They offer discount for military.
I've been coming here forever,  my girls grew up eating the Sicilian Pizza they absolutely love it. This place is great.

Just wanted to say thanks for the Hat-Tip treatment. I slunk in at more normal odd hour, wanted to go to this location for some time. This area of the city has a Temecula vibe.  I was greeted and sat at this time of day it's just who ever feels like taking the table so the stations haven't been assigned yet. The person I got was great they have no idea it will be the best tip of the day regardless of what I order.  I know what it's like to need people and no one is walking in the door. So I give more even short my order if I need. CPK really hires the cream of the USA Crop.  I ordered my regular double-fisted ice teas, with red velvet cake no ice cream. Then when it's time A barbecue chicken pizza on honey wheat dough add avocado and bacon with a side of garlic chili sauce make that two.  It's was great.  Only down side was the tables are way way to sticky.  I will be back queens of pizza.

I have been to this CPK several times and this visit was mediocre.  I had fish tacos which consisted 3 tacos filled mostly with cabbage and avocado and the smallest amount of fish you have every seen.  The service was subpar; had to wait for water refills and the check took forever to get.  My wife and son left while I waited for the check.  Not good, would not recommend this CPK.

Took the family to lunch on a Saturday afternoon, not busy at all. We were seated immediately. I ordered the chicken tequila pasta, it was mediocre. The chicken was a bit over cooked, and the pasta was dry. I have ordered this dish on several occasions in fashion valley mall and has never been this dry.  The pepperoni pizza was excellent. The dough was very soft, crispy and brown. A little more cheese could have been added but overall the herbs and pepperoni were a perfect addition to the excellent pizza dough. My son loved his kids cheese pizza. It was the perfect portion size for him and he even took 3 slices home.  My biggest complaint was my waitress went MIA. On 3 different occasions, we had to ask 2 servers walking by to refill our drinks, give me my check and for more napkins. She was not very attentive nor friendly at all. Not the best service. I'll be returning back to Fashion Valley.

3 stars on a Friday night because they can't keep up with the demand! walked in at 745ish and ordered beer and got it in 20 mins then ordered food got that 25 mins later and I asked for silverware and I watched my server take another order before grabbing my fork!!! Why would she bring me my salad and nothing to eat it with. we never saw her again until we asked for our bill. true the food was good as it always is, but that's no excuse to lack on customer service! I'd be lying if I said I wasn't coming back, so I will be back but not on a busy Friday night!! the veggie grilled salad is delicious FYI!

Food was good, but my server Javier made sure my experience wasn't the best. First he came to our table very late (it wasn't busy). He took our drink order, and we had to wait another 15 minutes for him to take our food order. He was never around or came back to check up on us. Every time we needed something he never acknowledged our table, when he finally brought us refills he basically just dropped it on the table. Overall cpk is good but Javier could've at-least tried.

Went to otay ranch mall to buy some shoes for my daughter. We were both hungry and decided to eat at CPK. I was greeted by a beautiful young hostess(sorry I didn't caught her name). I told her a sit for two please and  she smiled and told me to have a sit. Just wait a few minutes and I'll seat you. I said okay thank you. Few minutes later we were seated in a booth. Then got our drinks ordered. Shortly after our waiter brought my daughter and I freshly baked bread and dipping oil to the table. I place my order for a sausage, mushroom and pepperoni pizza. Oh man that hit the spot it was very good. Over all the service, food and cleanliness of the restaurant was excellent. Definitely coming back for some more pizza that for sure. That's all I got thank you and happy yelping :-)

There is a reason I gave them 3 stars and not 4 however, they do have good food for the most part. I ordered a pizza and it was good when I had some hot there. however, I had left  over and tell you what there pizza is not very good the next day. That was the gluten free.

Just ate at the Otay ranch location I was very satisfied with my server Daisy:) she has the best customer service skills and is extremely friendly. I will definitely be back just to see her. After a shitty day she really made us smile thank you Daisy

My dad's a veteran who served 27 years in the Navy and out of all the deals going on on Veteran's Day we decided to go to CPK. Such amazing service from our waiter Kyle Blaine!! Honestly the best server! He was very welcoming, attentive, and was constantly checking up on us. My dad enjoyed lunch even more. So thank you CPK!

Nothing wrong with a Stella with pizza n soup!! Hehe.  There is no one in here at 3 ish. So we got in on the lunch special till 4! Wanted some lunch b4 we went into the movie. Waitress was nice n friendly too. I had the shaved mushroom, olive oil and parm pizza with pea soup. Wow I love their pizza crust so lite n crunchy. Soup was fantastic too. I will have to remember to put barley in my pea soup next time. Tasty!  So now small popcorn next door haha. Bf had the picture, pep, sausage with Met salad! Another fab meal at California Pizza kitchen.

The first time we visited CPK was when they first opened and we were so disappointed in the service we didn't return until last week. We decided to give them a chance and we were glad we did. The service was outstanding which is hard to find in most establishments. The food and drinks were very good. We sat at the bar and shared a pizza and a salad.  We were so impressed with our server, Sam that we mentioned to the manager what a great employee she was. The manager was grateful for the feedback and went out of his way to make our dining experience special.

It's ok. Went in for lunch and there was no line. The host seemed really confused and wasn't sure where to seat us (there were plenty of tables open and it did not appear that they were in the middle of a lunch rush).  Tortilla soup had a lumpy broth and oil tracing the rims.  I asked to sub the lunch pizza for a margherita pizza. Not possible I guess.

Gone here a few times over the years, and things have remained consistent.  Our latest dinner here was on a weekday, around 6:30, not busy at all and we were seated right away. Lots of tables, they can accommodate larger groups. Clean. Nice location, in front of AMC by otay ranch mall. Our service was good. We were checked on periodically. Drinks, ordering, and receiving our food was all within a good timeframe. We were given warm bread with infused olive oil while waiting.  The food...  Tortilla soup- tasted kinda more like a bean soup, a thick consistency, but with a little hint of Spanish flavor.. It was just all right... Mushroom pizza- yummy.. If you like mushrooms on your pizza, you will like this dish. The flavor is so rich. Yum! Crust was chewy and toasty, I believe their pizzas are wood fired...  Kids pizza/Alfredo- what my kids got. They're both generous portions and the pizza was basically a smaller version of their regular pizzas (prepared the same way)...  My fave think on their menu is the THAI CRUNCH salad. Edamame, chicken, crispy thin white noodles, shredded cabbage, green onions, peanuts, etc, with a sweet peanut/sesame flavor.. We always get the full (large) serving... 3 of us shared 2 large orders, we like it that much... I've tried it with and without avocado, both ways are tasty.  Not usually our first pick for going out... But it's a place we go from time to time when craving their Thai crunch salad!

I called to make a Take-Out order and when I got there I called again just to let them know I was already outside. A guy answered and told me it would be right now. 40 minutes pass and I call again and no one answered. 15 minutes pass and I call again and still no answer so I decide togo inside and get it myself. My food was just sitting there, my pasta was all dry from just sitting there. The cashier (very lovely girl) was kind enough to take the pasta back to the kitchen so they could add more sauce and she said no one had told her I called to say I was already outside, so I don't blame her at all.  On a side note, when you call to place an order they always ask if you would like some bread. Every single time I ask for bread I don't get it, and when I don't ask for bread I do get bread. Write it down it's not that hard. Other than that, I got the original bbq chicken salad and the chicken tequila fettuccini. Both were very good! (like always)

One of our favorite spots to go with the family. The kids order there boring mac and cheese and order tons of the free bread with olive oil. The wife and I always seem to order the same things. We both share a Kung Pao Spaghetti with shrimp and a Waldorf Salad with chicken. Today we added sangria tasters which both added color to the table and taste! The place hardly gets too crowded and the food comes out in a timely manner. The service is always good to us especially since we always refill drinks and bread.  Ive had most of the flatbreads and they are also good. The hummus is always a good appetizer.  The take out service is also something we use. The food is easy to order online and they package everything perfectly. *Hint: you can ask for a bunch of free bread!

Stopped in today around 6pm, I ordered two pizzas to go. It took a long time to get anyone's attention to help me, and the girl that did had a bad attitude and was in a hurry and unkind. I had a hard time readying the menu since I forgot my reading glasses. After she helped me I asked for napkins which she very rudely handed me. Unfortunately did not get her name. She was a young pretty Hispanic girl.  It's too bad she gave such poor customer service. I will not be coming back here.

I've always been a fan of the food at CPK.  My go-to dish at this location is their Cedar Plank Salmon.  My daughter usually gets one of their pastas and she loves it. The food is really consistent and compared to the rest of the restaurants at this mall, the wait for a table is not too bad.  My only gripe is the service.  Waiters and waitresses have always been nice, but it seems to take forever for your orders to be taken and even longer for your food to arrive.   2016 Yelp Review #8
Very standard food, even with an updated menu.  Service this time was good, considering the driving rain and the holiday crowds.  Of all places to eat in this location, CPK is the best of most.

Ordered my usual Chicken Tequila Fettuccine and it was disastrous. The sauce was soupy almost like a broth on the bottom rather than a creamy fettuccine sauce. Fettuccine was undercooked. Pizza was mediocre. All bad. I love CPK but this particular location needs to get it together.  I just found out that on top of all this they OVERCHARGED MY CARD! My boyfriend and I split the bill of $50 I got charged the full $50 AND $25 extra and my boyfriend got charged $25. This place is ridiculous. If I could rate it zero I would!!!

Have been eating here for years and last 3 times that I have ordered some sort of salad, I end up returning it and then they make it right..  Why cant you make it right the 1st time.   This is the last time I eat here.  Major fail cpk.

My boyfriend and I tried tried the California Pizza Kitchen for the first time today. We were in the Otay Ranch Shopping Center running some errands and doing some shopping when we decided on pizza for lunch. After entering we were greeted right away and taken to out booth. I will say that the booth wasn't as clean, but we didn't mind. Our server was Shar and she was super sweet and awesome!! Since this was our first time she made some great suggestions with appetizers and desserts. She suggested the Avacado Club Rolls and we were so glad she suggested those to us because they were our favorite out of everything we had during our visit!! She was always very attentive and had had a great attitude (wonderful customer service!!). We also ordered the BBQ chicken pizza and it wasn't bad. It was served on a thin crust pizza with light BBQ and the chicken was scattered all around. We also ordered the chocolate cake like dessert with ice cream on top (athlsolso athlsolso suggestion from Shar) and we devoured that within minutes! Overall a good experience and worth coming in again. We hope to get Shar next time too!!!

Our first time dining at this establishment.  We ordered the pepperoni pizza, the chicken BBQ pizza, the Cobb salad and the mushroom pasta with shrimp plate. The size of the pizzas were kind of on the small side for the price we pay. The pizzas were good.  I would like to see the pizza's just a little bigger.  The chicken BBQ pizza was a tad bit on skimpy side with the toppings.  The Cobb salad was great in portion and toppings.  Great Cobb salad and the mushroom pasta dish with shrimp my Wife ordered  was real delicious.  Our server was great. My wife had a flight of wine and a  flight of the sangrias.  She enjoyed both of her flights. I enjoyed 2 different beers on draft. I would return to try out more dishes and pizza from the menu.
Not good place to go, servers are slow and it takes a long time to get and make your order. Foods are not that good too.

For a Chula Vista non-mom & pop corporate restaurant, it's a good place to go to. Convenient, accessible, close to the theaters, would make a great alternative to long waits at Cheesecake Factory or Buffalo Wild Wings (in fact, their food is much better than Buffalo Wild Wings), and a very good wine list compared to other restaurants in the Otay Ranch Town Center. We love their shaved mushroom & spinach flatbread, quinoa + arugula salad, and their chicken piccata entree. CPK's chicken piccata is the one dish I compare all other chicken piccata's to! It's very good (especially when paired with a good Chardonnay wine). Their house sourdough bread served with olive oil is also delicious. Remind your server to bring some bread over if it's not automatically offered. Our service was very good the night we had dinner. They offer a 9 oz wine serving which is a little more than 2 glasses for like $3 more (a pretty good deal)...

Love it here! The service is for the most part fast it's never too packed & the girls here are very friendly from the front door girls to the waitresses & until you leave they are always nice.  The food is always good. And you get FREE little breads with Olive Oil & it taste great! And I always get there tortilla soup, tho this is a pizza place I have to admit they have one of the best tortilla soups I've ever tasted! There Cesar salad is very good but I would ask for extra dressing tho because it can be a bit dry sometimes.  My fav pasta here is the Pesto Pasta, it's  made with the perfect amount of Pesto sauce & always well made & delicious. Now for the main reason I come here, the Chicken Thai Pizza! If my wife knew how to make this I would never argue with her & kiss her dirty feet (she likes to be barefooted in the house)  & massage her everyday & dance for her in my boxers!  Love it, comes with the bean sprouts & peanut sauce & veggies & the perfect amount of Chicken. All there pizza come perfectly cooked in thin crust & are good but this one is my favorite & the main reason why I come back. There outside patio is real nice & there bar is as well, there beer & wine selection here is pretty good. You can bring you're kids as well, there kids menu is reasonable. The prices are decent. It's a great place to come for lunch or for dinner after going to the movies next door & when you come order the Chicken Thai Pizza you won't regret it! And enjoy the FREE bread with Olive Oil of course.

The hummus starter is really really good. The chicken egg roll start was  second best. But hummus wins by a land slide.Worth getting. I didn't like the white corn guac. Hardly any flavor. My Thai salad was pretty good. I got the half size and that was still a lot. My bf got the rotisserie chicken with garden veggies, it was just a-ok.  Our experience was mediocre.
