It was funny because we ordered the white corn guac but said they were out, so we ordered the Mac n cheese. But they needed up coming out with the guac saying they were out of the Mac n cheese too.  Overall, it was a meh experience with average flavor/food. I knew why the last time I was at CPK was in high school (ten years ago).

Slow slow slow... ordered steak medium and it came out well done.. they sent it back and it came back well done. This place is a hit or miss. Definitely don't come during dinner unless you and your party have a lot to talk about. Honestly if this wasn't a chain and it wasn't conveniently 1 of the 4 big restaurants then this place would be out of business. Server barely refilled our drinks and came to check on us.

I love pizza and I've been to California Pizza kitchen before..in my prior experiences I haven't been let down but at this specific location was possibly the first. Upon entering it took maybe almost 5 mins to be greeted and then seated and it wasn't crowded nor was there a wait. My waitress was excellent and she provided great customer service and checked in with us multiple times which was great. Okay the pizza, it was good but it wasn't like "wow" & there was definitely lack of sauce.
Great service from Sonia! She was quick and most efficient! We fully enjoyed our lunch, though WE had to rush back to work. Next time we will come to enjoy a relaxing dinner with a Sangria!!

I felt compelled to write this review for the terrible service or, actually, lack of service. The place is not busy at all, and I think customers are catching on the lackluster service here. We were seated close to the other customers, but couldn't understand why none of the servers tended to us for the past 15 minutes. After finally asking one of the servers, it took 5 minutes for us to eventually get up and leave as no one came. There were a few servers standing by the host area, and that annoyed me to a point of speaking with the manager on duty. She tried to convince me to stay and be assured of receiving good service. It was too late. I have had very good experiences at other CPKs, but will take awhile to forget this incident, and may be reserved of choosing CPK as an option among other restaurants.

My daughter loves comming here she likes the pizza and the bread. I usually get the pasta but when we went last time we got the BBQ chicken it was pretty good. the only bad thing wAs I had a short curly hair in my drink :/ I was so glad I didn't eat it loll. Better my drink than my food because i was sharing it with my daughter. Other than that the service is great and the waiter was really nice and helpful also

I called tonight for a pick up order at 7:55 and as I ordered my items she repeated the order back to me and then she said I can do curb side or inside pick up I choose inside.  She said my order would be ready at 8:18 pm when my husband showed up to pick up they said they never received my order.  And they said it's a call center that receives my order and that they did not get it.  I'm so disappointed in them I'm never going back.  The manager was very rude and said you can order it now though.  Do not order to go they won't have your order!!!!!

The food was good I recommend the Caesar salad and the Sicilian pizza but the service is so bad. I went on a day where there was only 4 tables and it took over 20 minutes to get the check that's ridiculous.

We came here after a day of shopping and placed our name for a table for 4.  We were advised that the wait will be approximately 15-20 minutes.  After looking around the dining area, I noticed 6 tables/booths available for seating.  I noticed that both hostess were looking at each other dazed and confused and the manager walking back and worth speaking with them (also dazed and confused).  After waiting for 10 minutes,  we were finally sat at one of the booths that were available from the beginning.  When we asked for a high chair for my 1 year old, the hostess told us that they could not give us a high chair because it was against the fire code on a booth....Then sit us at a Freaking Table!!!  Clueless!!!!! The server was very pleasant (5 stars) and the food was average.

Today i had my daughters 7th Bday here and we were all blown away of the high customer service we received... The manager today was Jesse, super nice informative patient ( we had 14 kids)... Our waitress was khatia ( I believe) she was amazing, handling a group of almost 30 (with kids and parents) our orders kept coming out on time and everything was on point!!! We left her a huge til bc she deserved it very much!!! I will definitely be coming in again and recommending it!!!  Great job guys!!!
The Morroccan  chicken salad is delicious and fresh. Unique combo of beets, dates , marconi almonds and chunky chicken.  Pear and gorgonzola pizza is mmmmmm.

Today I went to have dinner with my son and Samantha our waitress took care of us she was absolutely fabulous she recommended a chicken club sandwich which was out of this world. Samantha thank you so much for everything that you did for me and my son we hope to see you again

I like Pizza! Who doesn't?  We stopped here one night while we were out shopping in the area. This is a nice CPK. There was plenty of seating and there was no wait to get our table. We were seated immediately. Things went down hill after that.  Our server sat us down, he was super friendly. However the service ended up being completely slow after that. I tried to pass it off that maybe there were other tables that we could not see that our server was being slow at coming back to our table each time.  The kitchen staff was able to prepare our food fast. And it was served to our table quickly except for one dish that one of my friends was waiting on. We let her have some of our food since she was waiting for her pasta.  After we were done eating, we actually had to get up and walk tot the bar area to ask if someone would be able to give us our bill to pay, since our server was not coming back around to our table.  Overall the food was good as it usually is when I come to CPK. They offer these new smaller dishes that are the perfect size and price. I even went home with left overs. This was my first time at this location and honestly due to the super slow service I had a hard time giving this a good review. Although that I know that the food is really good quality at CPK.  Maybe I will go back and try this place again. It makes me sad when you get service that is below par.

I been going to California pizza kitchen for years and they been a quick and nice made to grab a bite. I enjoy their selection of pizza and drinks. This location is very convenient to get to. The service is good and the food is always done right.

We came here a few days ago. The place was not fairly busy. Nice crowd of families. The place was clean and not too loud. We were seated in a decent time frame. The waiter was nice and took our drink order. Off to a good start. We get our drinks and then we place our food order. Everyone decided on the BBQ and Hawaiian Pizza. I wanted to try the Chicken Piccata. All set orders placed.  Now here goes to the bad and reason for the one star. Well I'm not sure if they had a shift change or not, but we waited a long time to get our food and the waiter was no where to be found. Empty drink cups! We finally get our food, by another waiter. The pizza crust was burnt and the pizza was also cold. Not hot right out of the oven. Maybe it was sitting?? I asked to have it remade. The pasta was also cold and lacked chicken. It pretty much looked liked a plate of just pasta, sauce and capers. The NEW waiter had an attitude about it. I'm thinking well, I did come here to eat HOT food, not cold and burnt. Last time I checked I was paying for this outing so I would like it my way.  No need to make a big scene. Paid and left.  Not sure if we will be going back anytime soon or in general.

CPK is always a solid choice for good, quality food choices. None of my recent visits challenges that. Salads are fresh, tasty, and they have a great variety to choose from. Pizzas are also top notch, original BBQ is still a classic, delicious and super fresh.  So, why the average rating. Across the board the prices are too high. Way to high. I mean $15 for a salad ($16+ with tax) for a salad that's 75% lettuce. Great salad but for over $16, the value is just not there, not even close. Same with the pizzas, smallish and $15 each.  Also, for in restaurant dining, service is spotty....for what you are paying, service here should always be top notch. It's not, sometimes, just plain horrible.

Somehow I never got around to reviewing this place. I know we come here at least three times a year. It's close by but what also makes it a good deal is that you can buy $100 of gift cards for $80 at Costco.  The food while not extraordinary is good and I've learned through trial and error what I should stick with. I'm a fan of their Jambalaya fettuccine. It is nicely spiced without overpowering. Generous amounts of shrimp, chicken, andouille sausage, and crayfish. I also like their roasted veggie salad. All sorts of grill type veggies. I have learned though that it is not worth (IMO) to add chicken to your salad or pasta. For the extra charge it is not worth it as the portion that comes is small. We once asked and they suggested next time to ask for a chicken breast to be served along with your pasta or salad for an extra charge. My kids like the pizzas of course but not just the plain cheese. This is one of the rare places where they have ventured and ordered say BBQ chicken pizza. Now if I could just get them to order something green on the pizza (cilantro or scallions aside) I'd be purchasing stock. My wife enjoys their lettuce wraps and the chicken tortilla soup.  Today I indulged with dessert, not a norm here. We ordered the chocolate soufflé. It was okay. It's consistency was bordering brownie like. However we also got the salted caramel pudding. We've got a winner here folks! A creamy pudding screaming CARAMEL at you with a crushed cookie bottom. I loved it.  It does get busy but service has always been friendly and attentive. Once my poor child ordered a Caesar salad (the one freaking time she did that on her own) and found some sort of beetle in it. Both server and manager apologized profusely comped the dish and offered her a replacement meal (though she was so put off she declined). I really appreciated that they focused on making sure she was good and talking to her like she was an adult.
Great Pizza, THE Sicilian thin crust is the only way to go!! Amber, for take out, always takes great care of us and makes sure our order is always correct and on time!!
CPK is my go to restaurant on sundays, the staff is always friendly, the place is clean and the food has been excellent! I definitely recommend this place, hands down.
Service was good but my chicken pizza came out so greasy. I know it's pizza but the oil was literally sopping the entire crust.

Always a very good meal. Nice mix on the menu choices. Service was great...friendly, attentive, professional. Thank you Samantha for making this another enjoyable dinner...glad we had your table again. Cheers!
Pizza was cold, orders the 5 cheese and tomatoes, and California club. Gave me a wrong pizza. They offer a gift card but will never again buy anything from CPK.

I have mixed emotions about this place and I have to be careful of what I post to review. Bottom line, I wish that the servers knew how to better take care of larger tables and groups. I wish that the food was better than it currently is.

Finally came here last night after I've been DYING to go, since I'm like obsessed w/ pasta. First off, their spinach & artichoke dip is AMAZING (perfect texture, perfect balance of ingredients) & the tortilla chips are fresh & crispy. I ordered the jambalaya pasta & it was sooo good. Love the generous amount of crawfish, shrimp, sausage & ham. I was also super amazed at how quickly our food was brought out. Everything came out perfectly cooked & we literally had all the food we ordered on our table in under 5-10 mins. Although our waitress seemed kinda rushed, I didn't mind since we were literally able to sit down, order drinks, order food, have the leftovers boxed & be out the door. I appreciate that kind of service.

First of all...very slow and bad service.  Food was overall good, but server was not attentive at all. We had to ask him 3 times and more to refill our drinks and never around when we need him. I can't believe how this restaurant trains their employees.  And finally I asked server to input my reward card number and I was told that he will, but never happened.  So I made sure that he would input after we got our bill, but he didn't. This might sound like nothing,  but I think that even small things that server was asked to do is also very important.. it is customer satisfaction.  The conclusion is that I was very unsatisfied,  and not sure if I should go back to a restaurant that ignores customers attention.

Pizza is one of my favorite foods in the world. But when it comes to CPK (California Pizza Kitchen), I say only this: their pizza (and pasta) is amazing! My favorite is the Sicilian thin crust pizza plus the four cheese ravioli. They also have a place to sit outside plus it's kid friendly. I remember going to CPK when I was a little kid and loved it there. As of today, I still am amazed by the selections that they have. If anyone wants to go to a pizza joint where they can spend time with family or friends or whoever, this is the place to be. I almost forgot to mention that they also have a ton of locations all over California. The one that I went to was in Chula Vista. Keep it up CPK! :-)

Have been here for both lunch and dinner.  We usually order up a pizza, pasta, and share a salad.     Really have enjoyed there Barebecue chicken pizza and there thai salad. From my experience there staff is pretty friendly, and quick.

My family and I have been visiting the Otay Ranch Town Center CPK for many years now.  The general manager, Jesse, and assistant manager, Russell have always made it a point to great all their customers.  I see them making time for every customer, not just us.  The wait staff, especially Mark, has been awesome!  Mark has a wonderful sense of humor.  He never fails to make us laugh. The food is absolutely delicious!  We love everything they cook up at this CPK.  We love the appetizers, main dishes and dessert.

Busiest days are usually Fri-Sun right? Came in about an hour ago and there was only a few others in here. Well that didn't help the server at all.  Took drink orders, then kept an impatient attitude when I said my party needed a little bit of time to decide what we wanted. Came back with the drinks. Fast forward to waiting on refills- brought it out only when we were done and not to mention never came by to see how the food was, etc. Go down the street to Tavern and Bowl and get better service, or just look around when you're in CPK and see that the lack of customers just might be a hint.
Close to movie theaters.  Gift you get the Jamaican Jerk pizza make sure you get the regular crust and not thin crust.

Had dinner here last night 4/29. Kids love coming here so we come at least 2 times a month and service is hit and miss. But, that all changed last night when we had Brian as our server. Excellent service all around he was friendly, attentive just had an overall wonderful experience.  Thanks Brian!!!

Business lunch was perfect.  Seated promptly, booth available and service friendly and prompt.  Food is consistently amazing.  Ordered my second favorite, chicken Thai crunch full order.  Could only finish half but I planned to have it as dinner later tonight.  Music was a little loud for a business lunch but not anything unbearable.  Definitely recommend for casual lunch or business meeting.

I stopped in for din and saw on the table an add for their small plates ( ). The items looked good, so I decided to order a few items from it. I ordered the petite wedge at $4.65, a spinach and mushroom flat bread pizza and a fennel sausage, and poblano flat bread pizza both at $5.95. The petite wedge was larger than I expected and came with a modest amount of savory bacon, a good creamy blue cheese dressing, and some chopped eggs and tomatoes ( ). The bacon was good, chewy, and slightly smokey. ( ) It was my favorite part of the salad, second was the creamy blue cheese. The salad came with some sliced sourdough baguette which was quite good and chewy. ( ) The bread was excellent with the herb filled oil oil served on the side. ( ) Both flat breads were enjoyable to eat. They use the same dough they use for their well known pizzas. The crust on both was light, thin with a slight elasticity. The mushroom and spinach was my favorite. (  The mushrooms had a pleasant earthy overtone and were lightly cooked. Everything just gelled well together specifically the well cooked and seasoned spinach. ( ) I thought the fennel sausage flat bread was good, but not as balances as the mushroom one. Don't get me wrong, it looked great (See), and it tasted good, but the sausage was a little weak in flavor ans lacked that aggressive fennel flavor. ( ) It was a little spicy, as advertised, and the poblanos tasted mixed with the melted cheese. ( ) I enjoyed a warm tea with my meal, and the service provided by my server Brian was spot on. He was well mannered and had a good sense of humor. I am definitely a fan of their well priced small plates...

what the heck happened?  use to be a decent place to eat.  good thing i didnt want a draft either, their beer taps werent working.  really?  how is that acceptable?  spinach fettucini with extra $4.50 DRY chicken.  makes you wonder when it was originally cooked, especially given the server came back and said it would take 8minutes to cook another piece.  did i mention the place was only 20% full?  the portions appear to be dwindling too.  first time ive ever finished the tequila chicken pasta.  and the server?  why do i have to ask for everything?  balsamic for the bread, parmesan and pepper for the pasta, napkins.  i dont think it is her fault however.  i was observing the manager, seems to me its his fault.  ive seen "managers" run a place into the ground before.  why, early on a thursday evening, is this place empty for dinner??  and wtf cant i get a stout???  oh yeah mr manager, your taps are down.  #getaCLUEdude

Dine in food and service are great, take out not so much.  My husband and I dine here regularly and enjoy the food and service, but my take out experiences are 0-3.  The first time, they had no record of me phoning in the order.  The second time I asked that there be no eggs in my salad, but when I got home, they were everywhere.  To their credit, they gave me a full refund.  Today, I ordered the Moroccan Chicken salad, no eggs.  I checked the salad before I left the restaurant to make sure there were no eggs and there weren't.  When I got home, I discovered there was no chicken either! Unbelievable!

I tried the spinach and artichoke dip, the pesto penne, BBQ chicken pizza and Thai pizza. They all taste standard to me, nothing great but nothing bad. The best out of what I've tried was probably the pesto penne. I would probably get it again if and only if I choose to come back. Place was very clean, big, and organized. But to be honest I don't think it's ever packed at this location.  All the waiters and hostesses seemed to not like their job and was really whatever about everything. Made me a little annoyed. Everything about CPK is a bit overpriced, but, it's a CPK, what do you expect. Maybe I'll come back for the pasta, and a drink? Maybe?

I always liked CPK's pizza's.  They also have some pretty tasty pastas here to consume.  This restaurant is in a prime spot next to the AMC theater and the Barnes and Noble.  Very clean restaurant, nice set up, it would be a good date spot to be honest.  Service has always been good for me.  Full bar too boot.

Two words. Hot mess. Worst service ever. I feel bad writing negative Yelp reviews, but there is no excuse for waiting over an hour for food. Especially when your server never checks on you or even apologizes for the wait. No refills and cold soup at this CPK location (Otay ranch). And servers that don't give a hoot about their customers. Management should pay closer attention when their employees are struggling and neglecting their tables.

A very good national chain american restaurant. Pizzas and salads are good. Ample kids menu. Kid friendly. Menu is more than pizza and chicken. Chicken chimichurri, fish tacos and chile relleno are a must. Clean, modern and great service. In my experience the majority of the servers at this location are bilingual.
Had a great lunch yesterday at this place.  Nice coconut speciality drink with a flatbread.

location: Chula Vista, San Diego, United States
review: First time here and I was really impressed with the atmosphere, food and service. I will return.  My husband loves the pizza and the options. Been here twice in less than a month.

This was my first time coming out to Otay even though I've been in San Diego for the last five years. I was surprised by the beauty of the complex this CPK is housed in. Super cute outdoor mall with tons of great shopping and dining options!  A group of 11 of us came on a Friday afternoon and the place was pretty empty (to be expected on a weekday afternoon). We were seated really quickly. Service was good and the food was the same great CPK quality you can always depend on!

I can only comment about the few salads and pizza I had and I always come back for it because I find it to always be great light and fresh! My favorite is the quinoa salad and watermelon strawberry salad!  Service is a bit slow but nothing bad!  It's nice to have a good place near by where we can eat good light food

Rude and discriminatory services against teenagers just trying to eat. I often pick up to-go items with my daughter and son and not once has there ever been an issue- I've always been greeted with excellent customer service. However, since my daughter went there alone, she was treated differently. Will not be going back to your restaurant again.

It's ok. I've had better pizza. Came here for my czn bday dinner.  Service was ok. Waited about 20mins for the Parmesan cheese. Ordered butter cake it was ok too. I've had better desserts.  Service from waitress was good, she was nice and friendly. Mgr came by our table since we flips & so was he, asked where we were from in Pi lol. Super nice! He brought back a cake for my czn.  Then we celebrated & sang HBD! The end.

This is my wife's and my favorite place to eat in the Eastlake area for lunch. To me that is saying a lot because Otay Ranch Center Mall as well as the surrounding area have a long list of places to dine. Been coming here for years. Every time California Pizza Kitchen has consistently brought real good service and food. Having a casual setting. They have indoor and outdoor dining. We have lately ordered the same two things to eat. The Italian chopped salad and the Meat Craver thin crust pizza. The only thing we deviated from our order is our drinks. I usually hate eating thin crust pizza. With the thin crust usually tasting like a cracker with toppings. But not here. The crust is chewing just the way I like it. With the added toppings of pepperoni, sausage, two kinds of ham and salami the Meat Craver is just great. Another thing I am not a big fan of is salads especially salads with garbanzo beans. But again, California Pizza Kitchen prepare it in a way that I truly enjoy eating it. The mustard vinaigrette dressing is tangy but not overpowering so you can taste the other elements of the salad- lettuce, turkey, salami, tomatoes, parmesan and of course garbanzo beans. The pizza and salad just go hand and hand. It's a great combo. Something we love to eat during lunch. I will also recommend their Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. I have eaten it in the past. Delicious. Again real good service. Real good food and drinks. The price to dine is fair. Overall, California Pizza Kitchen is a winner.

Twice a month I go to CPK LOYAL CUSTOMER.... The food is still good BUT WHAT'S GOING ON? The portions are 1/2 the size now! Appetizers and Main dishes, dessert are small too!  I don't like that!  If you're going to serve 1/2 the food reduce the price!   Unless this changes will be going to Cheese Cake factory more! AND WHY DID YOU TAKE THE TIRAMISU OFF THE MENU?  YOU ARE BUMMING ME OUT CPK!!

5 categories with 1 star max each. 1) Customer Service:  Our waitress, Kathia, was great! Attentive and fast. 1 Star + 2) Location: The location is nice and comfortable. Background music not too loud. 1 Star 3) Food: Had their lunch special BBQ chicken with extra onion.  Not good and not bad.  Recommend that you order something else.  1/2 Star  4) Beverage: Unsweetened ice tea with lemon.   Average taste.  The water is unfiltered.  1/2 Star 5) Cleanliness: The place was clean including the bathroom. 1 Star
Ordered to go for the first time today and it was the best customer service I've ever had ! I'm so excited to come back to dine in

Service was good and waitress attentive. The food was just "OK". Several years ago this place was unique but now just seems over priced with few healthy options. Most HALF salads are almost 1000 calories dripping in oils etc.
I love coming here. My food is always amazing and the atmosphere is the best. Their drinks are great as well. Definitely recommend the Moscow mule when you have the chance.

I haven't been here in a while. I used to eat here often and the food and service used to be great. The last few times I visited, the food was horrible and the service sucked. Food was barely warm and it was hard/stale. My last visit was on a night that was slow. Only a few people in the dining area. The food took forever to arrive, I had to ask for a water refill (which took a long time) and we sat there with empty dishes for a very long time before the waitress brought our check. Definitely not going back. Used to be good, but no longer.

This is a great place to eat! My wife and I love their buffalo cauliflower dish and their asparagus and arugula salad. But mostly, we've had the pleasure of being served by two great people on our many visits: Javi and Sonia. With their professionalism and friendliness, we feel at home when we eat here. Thanks so much guys!

I'm not a super fan of CPK but we were in the Chula Vista area and I was craving a delectable salad. Boy was I pleasantly surprised with the great experience at this location. Our server was Tamara who was super sweet and attentive, we couldn't have had a better person attending our table. Items ordered where: Peach Lemonade, Agave Mojito, Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings, Chicken Milanese plate, Roasted Veggie half plate salad, and a California Club Pizza. The drinks were very yum, the appetizer was delish, but the star's of the meal were the Chicken Milanese and the Roasted Veggie salad. Overall a home run, thank you CPK for your great customer service.

I am a weekly customer here with my family. I am giving today's visit a 2 due to the service of KATIA. I arrived to check in at the front desk, KATIA then told me I had to wait until a family of 4 walked in to the restaurant. Mind you they walked in after me..... NOT COOL KATIA! NOT COOL!

I enjoyed my experience here. I had the jambalaya fettuccine and it was pretty close to perfect. It was well seasoned and they didn't skimp out on the shrimp. I'm so glad I ordered it. I had the sangria also and it was so refreshing with the mango flavors. There was a bit of a wait but nothing out of the ordinary. Our server was attentive. I was given a gift card for Christmas and I'm definitely going to put it to good use.

The service at this place in Otay Ranch continues to disappoint. We were sat on a Friday night at 7:30 when restaurant about 2/3 full, for 15 min no one approached our table until i got up and walked to the wait station where servers chatted and complained about their evening. Food was ok, but I continue to wonder why they only operate at less than 50% energy.... At the end of my meal when paying the bill, server asked "do you want to speak with the manager about the wait and inconvenience"...seriously?

I've been here about a handful of times and I've always had an okay experience eating here. The food is good but I feel like it's a bit pricey for what you get. We ordered the Asian crunchy salad and the Pulled pork habanero pizza as well as the jambalaya pasta. The salad was the best part of the meal. The pasta was okay I wouldn't order it again..the noodles were undercooked and the flavor of the dish felt like it was lacking something. The pizza was good but nothing special it came with habanero sauce on the side which wasn't spicy at all it tasted a bit watered down. The only reason why I come here is because it's conveniently in the mall. The ambiance is nice though

The first time I came here I was impressed. The second time I came here was about one month later. That should let you know that's I couldn't stay away for too long.  The atmosphere is great the food is great the service is top notch!  I recently had a salad with their AMAZING HOMEMADE DRESSING. This stuff is so good that I requested it be bottled so I could take it home. To my surprise they actually sell it and gave me two bottles I paid $4 for 2 bottles the bottles themself cost a $1 at a dollar store so basically I paid $2 for two full bottles of their dressing which is COMPLETELY WORTH IT!!!!!

I've been to other California Pizza restaurants and the other ones have better service and food. The only thing that tasted good here was the pizza. The soup and salad wasn't great. Plus our server was on snail pace. She even picked her ear while taking our order. Who wants to eat after seeing that?! She didn't even offer to refill my water like she did at other tables. Not cool. The only good thing was the supervisor  or manager who came around was nice. I had to ask him for the check since our server disappeared.

The originator of the BBQ Chicken Pizza. And I like how you can substitute the crust with honey wheat. Good stuff right there. 4 stars from me. =) My star rating went down because of their 'new' thing - individual appetizers. We tried the guac & chips and the crispy mac & cheese. Yea, they said individual, but they're so tiny for about $4 each plate. I think that's just overpriced. The crispy mac & cheese was pretty flavorless too. At other restuarants, $4 appetizers can get you so much. I mean c'mon. Down to 3...
Never disappointed; tried their guac for the first time and loved it had corn and peppers in it but wasn't spicy at all.

The five stars if for the great food. (Service is pretty good, but nothing that stands out) I come here quite a bit when i am craving my favorite WALDORF CHICKEN SALAD. Dont be fooled by the fact that its a salad. It is loaded with tender chicken, candied walnuts, grape halves, celery, and fetta cheese and the best dressing to get with it is BALSAMIC VINAIGRETTE.  There is parking right in front of the restaurant and its near the mall so it's perfect if you are planning to head to the movies after, shopping, book-reading at barnes, etc. Great location and cariety of food.

I have no complaints about this restaurant. The food is really good, service is always great, and prices are reasonable. Sign up for their rewards card for deals/discounts. The restaurant is always clean and you get a nice view of the kitchen so you can see what is going on. I personally prefer takeout, and I have never had any issues.

I have never had a "wow" experience at ANY CPK in particular. I have never said, "hey, let's go to CPK!" - with that said, I haven't been to a CPK for about.... 6 years. So when my friends wanted to go there for dinner, I thought I'd give it a fighting chance.  Our group of six were greeted by a young front door hostess who hurriedly went to get a table ready for us. She seemed a bit nervous or flustered with our large group because she couldn't give us an estimated wait time. We were seated within 5 minutes, so plus points. Once we were seated, our drink orders were taken right away and our dinner orders shortly after. THEN... the wait... and more waiting. I understand it takes longer for a larger group to get their orders, but all our drinks were more than half way finished and we didn't even receive any BREAD to munch on! parties, large and small, who were seated after us all got bread and butter. My friend pointed out, "Maybe you just have to ask for bread?" Ok, fine, maybe they're trying to be bread-conscious and serve bread to those who ask for it... but honestly... i haven't been to CPK in a while, if this was my FIRST experience with CPK and I didn't know i had to ASK for bread and i saw others getting bread, i'd be ticked! AND I WAS! What they SHOULD do is ask if we would like bread while we waited for our dinners. I asked for bread and we got it promptly. I'm not sure if that's really their policy but it sucks. They should just ask their customers if they want bread instead of having us ask for it ourselves. Anyway, their only saving grace is that their pizzas are pretty good. I got the California Club and my bf got the Jamaican Jerk. They were both pretty good, however I wish I had some kind of ranch sauce for dipping. Their pizzas are on the dry side - not much sauce. Another minus was that our waitress asked on ONE occasion for ONE person out of our 6 person group if he wanted a refill. As for the rest of us, we had to repeatedly ask for refills. Even asking for a refill she got one out of three cups and then forgot about the other two. We had to remind her to get us more refills. Well, CPK you lose. you failed to redeem yourself despite your pretty-OKAY pizzas. it wasn't enough to overcome the poor service, bad bread policy (if there even was one - maybe she just forgot to give us bread?), and overpriced menu.

It's our tradition Friday night date spot. We always go and either get the same delicious pizza's or if we're feeling crazy we'll try something new. We always have great service and everything is always brought out timely. What we can't live without and gets us going back each week- the Avocado Club Rolls and Spinach and Artichoke Dip! Both are absolutely delicious. Especially the different sauces for the Rolls- OH MAN!! As for pizza, we've tried many. I've seemed to always go with Five Cheese and Tomato (YUM!!!!) and he always tries something new, but out of all, his fav is the Sicilian so far. We try to either go before 4 or after 8/9. Parking is ridiculous in that parking lot (between other places to eat and the movie theater), it can get obnoxious to drive around for 20 minutes and stalking those walking out to their car (awkward!). All-in-all- Great stop! Definitely recommend!
Idk why everyone is giving cpk bad ratings there pizza, pasta, and salad are really good. But I have to say they have pretty weird waiters and waitresses.

Once again the half star system is needed on YELP. 5 star taste on pizza, but expensive - here is definatly a case of high quality and getting what you pay for.   Service was OK.  Nothing exceptional yet consistant! The cost is a deterent but it was good.

3.5 stars would have been more appropriate but... I'm no longer convinced the Saturday wait and price was an even exchange for the service and food I got on my last visit...  It's been a long time since I have visited a CA Pizza Kitchen (10 years?), and where I don't mind paying a few extra bucks for better food/service, I'm not convinced I got either this time.  Since I had so many good experiences with them back in the dy, I'll probably give them another shot hoping this trip was out of the norm.  Their Margherita & BBQ chicken pizzas are some of my all time favorites so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.
Very nice place to eat dinner.not loud and the staff is very friendly.recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice place to have dinner

Ended up eating here since we walked out of the horrible service at Buffalo Wild Wings. We were sat down immediately and within minutes our drink order was taken. Our drinks arrived quickly and we placed our order. Food came exactly as ordered and was delicious. Our waitress Leigh was very attentive and checked in with us a few times. We will be coming back more often.

CPK may not be the greatest pizza, but I wouldn't know because I don't go there for their pizza... The thing that keeps me coming back is their split pea soup. I know, it may sound strange, but after you try a bowl, you will understand why. It is also made without bacon, so all you vegetarians out there can enjoy it as well.  Their salads are also pretty fresh and tasty. You have to have some serious issues to f up a salad.

This is is solid for good eats.  Their Thai Chicken pasta is my favorite, as well as their Thai Chicken pizza.  The works never fails either.  My kids love eating here as they have a good selections on their kid menus.   Service is hit and miss.  Waiters are friendly and a bit goofy, but their attentiveness isn't always there.  I still like stopping by from time to time though.
The manager Jess  takes very good care of us when we go there. We really like the chipotle pizza and tostada pizza as we got tired of the regular pizzas we ate outside of CPK!

Last week I visited this place and I was happy with the service and food. Manager came and greeted us personally. I thought this was a good touch. Food came pretty fast. We ordered the new Margarita Pizza's and they tasted delicious. over all I really recommend this Place. Most of the good experience came with actual eye contact of the waiter who did  go extra mile to get us bread and crushed red peppers excetera. Wait time was very less. I'll revisit this place again in my next trip.

I have eaten here many times, and am wondering why you don't? CPK... you get very good, very tasty food.   Here are a few of my recommendations: 1. Ask for whole wheat dough for your pizza. Anything with different kinds of cheeses will work for you! The pizzas are truly mouth watering. *Caution: split the pizza too.. or you're end up eating the whole d$%m thing! 2. Split a salad! The salads are wonderful and the portions are very generous, even for the 1/2 size. The chicken waldorf is my favorite. The tastes and textures here are devine! Get the dressing on the side &/or ask for the low-fat/fat-free kind. 3. If you want soup, you can do half & half! The soups are yummy. If you're looking to just hang out and order a few appetizers and drinks. The place has a cool, laid-back feel. The drinks are good. They do get a little busy on weekends so don't hesitate to flag down your bartender, server, etc! Your food will also take a little longer, but it is well worth the wait. Note: I wouldn't come here for their "other" dishes: pasta, seafood, etc. If you want seafood go to King's next door, go to an Italian place for your pasta, and if you want a place where EVERY sort of thing is delicious... CHEESECAKE FACTORY! =)

I placed an order this evening for pick up and am highly disappointed.  I have never experienced bad service at this restaurant until today.  I ordered specialty pizza, chicken lettuce wraps, and a kids meal.  Everything came out, but when my food was delivered to my car I asked for more lettuce and the waitress didn't bring me more.  In my online order I stated four people were eating and only three pieces of lettuce were given for all of us to share.  We also did not receive the sauce that accompanies the lettuce wraps.  The bread that came with our order only came with three pieces.  I can't believe this happened especially since we always visit this location.  Needless to say I'm just not sure if we'll be back.

Good service, terrible value. Ordered carry out here and they were 25 minutes late with our food. Pizza was cold and is the size of the $5.99 jobs at a Dominoes. The Waldorf salad was good and reasonably-sized. We got four tiny pieces of sourdough.

The food is good - avocado club egg rolls are a must have and the garlic chicken pizza is yummy.  I am only giving 3 stars because the service was ok and when I asked for a box for my pizza she took the pizza back to the kitchen and never brought it out to us - I only remembered the next day that she did this :(

location: Chula Vista, San Diego, United States
review: It's hard to go wrong with this place.  The service is often hit and miss but the quality of the food is always at least above average if not great.  A great restaurant to visit when you can't decide what exactly that you are hungry for.

What a wonderful restaurant and business!  We held a fundraiser night there and they were responsive from day one answering my questions promptly.  The evening of the event, the servers were attentive. I was worried that some people would forget their flyer and my server said he had extras in his apron in case this happened. As I visited with many families, my server asked me if I wanted him to bring my food to another table. Such great server.  THEN, the evening THAT VERY SAME DAY, I got an email telling me how the fundraiser had done and thanking me. What!!!!  Finally, I got a call just a few days later letting me know that the check for our percentage had arrived and was ready for pick up.  When I went in to pick up the check, I was complementing the manager and he told me the General Manager just happened to be there and introduced me.  I got to tell him how much we had enjoyed our time there. From beginning to end, our CPK experience was a delightful surprise. I can't wait to go back!  Thank you CPK.

Food was exceptional.  But service was terrible. When it comes to going in for happy hour no specials. When it comes to  ordering drinks from the bar they need serious improvements on thier time of service.   Food very tasty. But pricy. Expecially for the amounts of other eateries in this area,  that hold a competitive happy hour menu.

Two stars is probably generous considering our experience at CPK tonight. I feel a bit silly now looking back on it...all the signs that a terrible experience was about to ensue were present, I just chose to ignore them. My first tip should have been the lack of customers in the restaurant. Sure it was a Wednesday night, but it was 6:30 and the shopping center was busy. I thought maybe we lucked out and were just ahead of the evening rush. Not so much. When we walked in we were seated promptly in a booth by the bar. There were only a handful of other customers scattered throughout the restaurant.  Our server came out quickly and took our drink order. One goose martini, one Stone IPA (in a bottle with a glass, since we were informed they did not have Stone on draft), and one lemonade. After a few minutes we look over and see our server preparing the martini behind the bar. This would not be a concern if she looked as though she knew what she was doing or it was the best drink we ever had. Unfortunately, the martini came out half empty and the beer was a bottle of Stella Artois. Thankfully I caught this before the server opened it; however, upon her realizing her mistake she also realized the don't carry Stone IPA...at all. My husband settled for a Rogue and we proceeded to order.  My mother and I decided to partake in the dinner for two special, which our server was not very familiar with to say the least...even though we all had it in our menu and it was discussed with us by the hostess. The special came with an appetizer, two entrees, and dessert. We ordered spinach and artichoke dip, a BBQ chicken salad (hold the tortilla strips), a pepperoni/mushroom/sausage pizza, thin crust (hold the oregano), and hubby ordered a garlic chicken pizza separately. We would order desert after the meal.  The spinach dip came out in record time...and that was the only part of the meal this restaurant seemed to consider time sensitive. The meal itself took about a half hour (let me take this moment to remind you again how the restaurant was not busy). When our meal finally did arrive, we were short the pepperoni pizza. The kitchen staff accidentally put oregano on it and was going to remake it. The process of remaking a pizza must be cumbersome and convoluted because my husband and I were well finished with our meals before it came out. This is also after asking the server where it was a couple times, and a visit from the manager.  After awhile we asked they just box it up since everyone was finished with their food and understandably irritated by this time. The manger brought out the box, apologized again and walked away. Our server took another ten minutes to find her way back to us to see if we needed anything further. Umm yes, the dessert we are paying for. Red velvet please. After another 15 minutes the cake came out (they must have been baking it from scratch) and we paid our bill and left.  We had $7 taken off our bill. That is what CPK felt we deserved after having the worst dinner and service we have had in at least 4 years. We will not be back.  The food was good, which landed the two stars; however, the pizza they redid still had oregano on it. We didn't feel it was worth the hassle of mentioning it, nor did we feel like they would care.  Get your act together CPK. No wonder there was no wait for dinner.
Came here for the first time, really good service, and food was given to us within a fair time. The food was delicious! I would love to come here again.

Had such horrible experience last night 7/5/15 8pm at California Pizza Kitchen @  Otay Ranch, the server Mike H. And who was supose to be the manager in shift Brian were extremely rude and unethical not only did they got our oder wrong and glasses were dirty and employees were fooling around like if they were at a elementary play ground . Extremely disappointed i can see this branch closing soon due to thier poor customer service after my experience and reading so many bad reviews they i have no dought in telling anyone to think about it twice before going to the Otay Ranch location very poor service.

This CPK is nice and has a lot of space. However, that's the only good thing about the place. To start with the food was horrible and probably the worst I've ever eaten. It was so bad that CPK should be on kitchen nightmares. I mean everything was cold and it was so bad I'd rather eat out of the McDonald's dining room floor.  Second, the service was also horrible. All of the servers should just stick to fast food restaurants. Finally, I think that ever since they switched from Pepsi they've gone to the shit. Don't expect me back.

Having a kid with celiacs disease is hard. We can't go to most places because asking for gluten free is like saying a string of curse words. They looked shocked and amazed you would ask for that . California pizza kitchen is the exception to that rule. They offer gluten free pizza at a good cost and my  9yo child loves pizza so celiacs friendly CPK is the only place we can get him take out. Not only was it gluten free it was as he told me really good. My son asked me to write this review because this is the first time he was able to order take out since his diagnosis.

Four stars, I am very frugal with the stars and I didnt think CPK was going to get this from me at first.  The service: Excellent, their over priced food was also delicious.  You cant go wrong with the original bbq chicken pizza (large enough for two to share). Nice cocktail selection as well and located in a nice outdoor mall.

We eat here often, and the food has been consistently good. I get the Chicken Picatta with the pasta or the Sicilian Pizza. They are both so good that my mouth is watering as I write. The only reason I gave four stars is because my chicken was undercooked one time.

I decided to have lunch today at CPK and I ordered the lettuce wraps which are great when you're trying to eat healthy. They were amazing in there definitely big enough to share for two people. Mark our server was awesome food was great the great customer service I will definitely be back.

Absolutely horrible and has gone down hill. They use frozen chicken for all there products except the salads and pasta. Went there tonight and had globs of mayo in my club pizza. Husband ordered his use to be favorite waldorf salad and the salad tasted like it was bad. When we spoke with the manager he was actually rude! It was just an absolute horrible experience the food has just gone down hill!!!

The service here was great and food was good. Their selection of pizzas has changed quite a bit over the years and a lot of my faves has disappeared. It does come down to personal preference but the pizzas here are hit or miss.  The original bbq chicken pizza was delish! But the california club was highly disappointing. I don't think that should even be called a pizza since it was basically pizza dough with a salad on top of it. As in nothing was baked into the crust except the few pieces of bacon. This is a nice place to hang out and split a few pizzas with friends or family. It is located in the Otay mall so it's in a great location for you to grab some food and do some shopping. I would eat here if I happen to be in the area but I don't think it's something I would go out of my way for.
It's CPK what do you expect.  The service was good, the food is good, and I'd definitely take my family again.  They don't offer military discount here.

Located in a nice, outdoor suburban mall, across the street from the AMC 12 theater, I figured the food would be decent, somewhere in between Pizza Hut and Pizza Nova. ( ) The food was decent but not the best it could have been.  The soup was barely warm and the pizza was fresh cooked but not "fresh out of the oven" hot.  I think they must have put it aside until the other dishes were ready.  The dumplings that were an appetizer (small bites?) were bland.  It was an hour before closing and I could already hear the cooks and other kitchen staff beating and banging the pots as they were cleaning up.   Another effect of getting here near closing time - the servers were getting the "almost time to go home" syndrome and were not being as attentive as expected.  Or, as some other Yelpers have noticed, the service might just suck all the time.

Great service, especially for a Saturday. Not too crowded with great atmosphere. What really made the whole experience with the service of kathia behind the bar. She was handling everyone at the bar with efficiency and kindness. Super impressed, I will definitely come here again.

I started meeting here with friends for lunch. Since there is a big group I was worried about the food being served on time and them being able to handle a crowd. They have a great patio that we overtake. The management here is wonderful. Willing to work out a system so everyone can have a good time but get out in a timely manner. Bonus: The food is fantastic!! While I am eating my food, which is delicious, I am eyeing what others got and can't wait to try that next time. Usually I am a girl who sticks with the same thing every time, not here.

They have a brand new Miso Shrimp Salad on the menu - excellent! As always, great food, great service, great location, ample parking, separate take-out entrance for fast service.  Immediately across from the AMC Otay Ranch Town Center theatres.  Yum!

Came in for lunch with my girlfriends that I haven't seen in a while. We decided to sit on the patio... Big mistake ! I felt like we were neglected the whole time. Service was extremely slow, which I am not sure why because there was literally 7 other tables sat. Drinks took forever to come, they were only waters. A different server brought the food out and we didn't see our server until the end of the meal when we were ready for our check. We wanted to order actual drinks but was over it. Why wouldn't she come and see how the food came out ? Food was good but the pasta needed more sauce. We were just ready to get out. Then we waited 10 minutes before we went to the front to pay. If we asked for the bill I would think she knew we'd be ready to pay. Guess not. I'm disappointed because I usually like this place, but I just won't do this location.

CPK what can I say, you make some neat pizzas everyday. But for the price I pay is not the way for a constantly broke person today.  But damn the salads are pretty big and tasty if your a herbivore than a carney. Sticking to my veggie practice a yummy plate of grilled veggie salad was placed in front of me. Tomaotes, grilled asparagus, avacado, corn and a leafy green mix it was Nothing exciting and nothing to wow about but between CPK and eating panda, I rather chose the quality over price.

Jumbaliya Pasta is bomb! Shrimp, bacon, sausage and crawfish in a cajun red sauce! BTW the waiter Sergio was on point! Didn't have to ask for refills, napkins or bill! Plus his customer service was top notch!
Average. I get the miso salad, it's ok not great. They have good service, but the food is average and it's not cheap

I must agree with most of the reviews here. The service really does suck. My friends, my boyfriend and I ate here on a Thursday night and the restaurant was only half-full. We were seated immediately..that's great, but expected. Our waitress gave us time to decide our orders. She brought our drinks, appetizer and pizza on time too. So far, so good. All this time, she looked bored. I understand if you don't like your job, but the restaurant wasn't even busy. (Note: We ate here during wildfire week, when the air quality still wasn't good. I know, we're so bad.) Even when I asked her to take a picture of my group, she seemed to fake a smile, plus the picture turned out bad! Ok, so maybe that was a rant. My boyfriend and I came back to this location a week later just because we love CPK's pizzas. Service was slightly better than last time, but still not good enough. If it weren't for CPK's crabcake appetizer, BBQ chicken pizza, and Jamaican Jerk pizza (I like this, my boyfriend doesn't care for it), I would just drive further to the Fashion Valley location for the same food with better service.

It's Friiiidaayyyy!! That means only one thing, it's Freestyle Time! Here's my re-take on a West coast classic by 2pac & Dr. Dre (to the tune of California Love, Enjoy!!) California...Pizza Kitchen California...Pizza Kitchen In the citaaay of S.D. In the citaaay of Chula Vista In the areaaa, the area of Eastlake At the Otay Ranch Mall! At the Otay Ranch Mall! [Verse Two] Out at the mall, who to call?, California Pizza kitchen Soon as I look at the menu, my eye starts twitchin' Fiendin for Santa Fe Chicken and alcohol, Original BBQ or The Works, I'll try them all Only in Cali where we survive on Carne Asada to live and die In S.D. we put it on Pizza not only French fries (that's right!) Dressed in Veggies,pepperoni and chicken too, CPK knows exactly what to do Flossin but have caution they have pasta too Famous for the BBQ chicken, its worldwide It is recognized from Pacific Beach to Rosecrans Take your time and eat like a slow man, it's my time!
